Fun way to see Hong Kong and meet the people. A really fun and inexpensive way to see the sights and sounds of Hong Kong. Pretty easy to navigate and local riders are very helpful. The ding ding is even more fun in the rain as you can take in the sights and stay dry. Really enjoyed touring the city in these narrow double decker trams.
Fun for the Family. We did this for about 1 hour. We took the tram through the city and then a like distance back again before hoping off at our location.Great fun way to the see the city!
Must go- Besides San Francisco, trams in HK! . The only worthwhile transport in HK. Take any line to see HK at work. Cheap and an experience. Prepare HK coins for fare. And a fan!
OnlY one in the world. Only one city on the world has a double decker trams and its really nice experience! Local people call it ding-ding(sound) and its typicly for Hongkong:-)

Slice of old HK. I love taking the tram, its a lovely way to see the city! Not ideal if your in a hurry but takes through the heart of central passing some of HKs world famous buildings. Even better at night when everything is all lit up! Its also a bargin- like 3HKD ???!!!

Delightful. There's no A/C but we went there during the end of the winter and at night, so it wasn't so bad. Skip the hassle of dealing with the heat.
It was a pretty fun experience and not to mention, its relatively cheap.
If you ever visiting HK, don't miss the tram ride!

fun to see, but its a transportation not attraction. a tip: you pay upon EXIT, so do not be confused when your driver does not "accept" your payment on embarkation or scream after you when you disembark

Love the tram. I love riding the tram! Once you get hang of it, it really is so easy and CHEAP! Another great way going around HKG! This is what most of the locals use to get around... and I have to say it's so fun! If you don't have an octopus card, make sure you have lots of loose change.

Round around wth tramways. Here in Hkg they call it DingDing.
Actually we just wanna kill our time...just hanging around the area n coming back to hotel... It is located right on the back of our hotel... so very near
The tram is clean n always fun ...
Fast and nice if you are not local. Great transportation, the oldest in the city but very efficent to move in Hong Kong and in the same time admire the beauty of the city.

A Fun Way to Sightsee. Hong Kong is a fairly expensive place to visit, and to avoid spending a lot of money on taxis, we found that taking the tram was a great way to travel. We picked a rainy day, and it was a good activity. For only $2.30 HKD per person, you can go from one end of the line to the other, enjoying the views along the way. However, we did it during the late afternoon, and since the tram takes the city streets, it was very slow going. We finally got off somewhere about halfway down the line and took the MRT back to Central. That said, it's a nice experience and definitely does feel like "Old Hong Kong," and it's interesting to get to view all the neighborhoods along the way. Best during non-peak hours!
Great way to see Hong Kong. It is quaint and a great way to see the town . Try and get seats at the front on the top as the views are amazing

Can't be missed!!. Any visit to Hong Kong must include a ride one of of Hong Kong's famous trams on Hong Kong Island. This was a fun way to get around the island. The trams look pretty but do avoid peak hours. They were very cheap (HK$2.3) no matter how far you go. There is no air con but the breeze through the windows is enough to cool you down. You get on at the back and off at the front paying on your way off. Small change is required and be aware you don't get change so as close to the correct amount as possible is advised.

A nostalgic way to travel. We boarded the tram in the centre of Hongkong city and took it all the way to North Point. We were intrigued by the wet markets there and found ourselves mingling with the locals as they shopped for their live fish and fresh meat. There were other stalls selling clothes, bags etc. We used the octopus card which is like a multi rider for those in Australia. We bought ours at the local tourist bureau. They are the old double decker buses from British rule.
One method to move from A to B.. Nice way to move on, when you are at the Central area. Old but still charming. Very many people. Cheap.

Smooth ride!. One of my favorite things to do when I'm in Hong Kong. From Central all the way down to CWB. Very comfortable and relaxing. Window seats are great, especially in the summer, to catch the breeze from outside! Fun way to travel across Hong Kong Island!

Traditional transport in HONG KONG!!!! MUST TRY!!. Ding Ding has been my favourite public transport due to I have been taking Ding Ding since I was in primary however I moved to the UK. But this time when I came back I saw most of the old version Ding ding's are gone. if you're lucky enough to find one that's made out of wood( There's only one at the moment left). Nowadays it's mostly airconditioned and bigger than the traditional ones.It is the cheapest public transport in Hong Kong, An adult is around 2.3 hkd.

Nostalgic way of transport on HK island. Great old fashioned way of travelling from east to west and vice versa on Hong Kong Island. The Ding Ding rides slowly but takes you almost everywhere where you want to go on Hong Kong Island. It costs less than one dollar per ride and you pay while exiting(!) the tramway in the front(!). Use your Octopus Card. Great first impressions of Hong Kong especially if you can manage to get a seat on the top level of the tramway.

Cheap historic transport. The Tramways are a taste of historic Hong Kong travel. Be warned not to bring heavy luggage though and have your maps or GPS ready to warn you of the next stop. It's a cheap, fun experience for urban travellers, but can get difficult during rush hours. Also, don't expect airconditioning here.

Not taken the tram in Hong Kong? Get on it right away.. Ok youre heading to hong kong and are not going to take the tram to anywhere ? SERIOUSLY ??? One journey you need to make, really need to make is TAKE THE TRAM from Central, anywhere on that road in that area GOING TO HAPPY VALLEY, its just $2.30 HKD for an adult.But, the journey, taking you through WANCHAI, CAUSEWAY BAY (Times Square) and onto Happy Valley, will really make you HAPPY.Happy valley has the racecourse and a huge Hindu Temple, besides a fantastic seafood restaurant just where your tram terminates. But, this journey is something you will never forget, its really wild and fantastic.Be sure to JUMP ONTO THE TOP DECK, SEATS RIGHT IN FRONT of the tram. That is the focal point where you POINT AND SHOOT and a lot of shooting you gonna do for sure. Happy TRAMMING.

Ding Ding Ding. The cheapest public transport in Hong Kong. Paying less than HK$3, the tram will take you from the east of the Hong Kong island to the west. The journey takes over an hour, bringing you slowly through the old, modern, and business districts of Hong Kong, a unique sight seeing experience.Since the trams don't have air conditioning, avoid travelling in it during hot summer and peak hours.Choosing a seat on the upper deck will give you a better position to look around and much better street views.

Ding Ding (Hong Kong Trams). Taking trams at Hong Kong Island is one of funny way to explore Hong Kong. You can ride from Central to Wanchai and Causeway Bay, you better go upper deck because you can see beautiful views.

Different way to see HK. If you've got time to kill, ride the dingding from one end to another. Costs 2.30HKD no matter the distance you travel. Use octopus card or prepare exact fare. Sit on the upper deck.
Heritage transportation. you can see the whole HK island from east to west, transiting from modern financial Central to vintage residential Chai Wan. Cheap fare!

Must do in Hk. I live in HK. I take the tram from central to north point often. I love it during off peak hours. It's uniquely HK and a great way to see the city. It is the cheapest but slowest way to get around. Don't take if you are in a rush or carrying a lot as its not spacious.

The cheapest way to get around. The ding dings are a remnant of the British era and offer a nostalgic and very cheap way of getting around. The system is very easy and trams run frequently. If you are looking for comfort (comfy seats, AC,...) this is not for you.....It is more a combination of public transport with an experience. We loved it...

Travel all over the Island. These quirky trams traverse Hong Kong Island, slowly (sometimes I think it would be faster to walk) but its a fun way to watch the Island go by. Beware though that you know where you're going as its easy to get on the wrong tram and most drivers and passengers wont speak english. There are generally timetables and info on where the trams are heading at each stop
funny ride. It was a funny experience and we just used the ding ding for a short ride as we were too lazy to walk. it was hot outside and the airflow while driving upstairs was refreshing.

Nice view. I went on Ding Dong from Central to Causeway Bay, though a small journey but enjoyed it thoroughly. Try taking a seat on the upper deck, you will enjoy the view. But as it was a very hot day, therefore was a bit difficult travelling by it as they are not air conditioned. But very cheap mode of transport, just $2.3 for a ride, you gotta enter from the back and exit from the front and way while exiting from the tram.
Old fashion ride in Hong Kong Island Streets. Cheap and old fashioned, it's a very good way to travel around Hong Kong during the hot, humid and breath less summer days.

Old and nasty. Why ride the tramways when there are so many quicker ways to get around (taxi, MTR, bus). These "Ding Dings" are old and I'm still surprised they are functional.The only thing that's good about them is the name.

Loved it!!!. Loved the experience. Is very very cheap ride. You get in and pay on your way out with the Octopus card. It only serves the Hong Kong island side and all along the harbor area. A must do.

'Must Do'. A great way to see the old and new HK.We went the whole length from east to west.Sitting upstairs you can get some lovely photos.Very cheap,using the Octopus card.On a hot day it was the place to be for a couple of hours.

A Hong Kong Must. The Hong Kong Island Tram is a must do on your next trip to this wonderful city. See how the locals live by experiencing a ride on these world famous trams. Travel the full journey then return. You will soon learn why the locals call these tram " Ding, Ding's".

You Gotta do THIS! Trolly for fun. Well, I used to think they were just for fun. Not anymore! Super practical too! Our hotel is the Butterfly on Waterfront, and it's more out of the way of MTR stations, then I am used to, so 1 block away from the hotel is the main road where these trollies roll. Now with a simple 1 block walk, I'm on the trolly heading to Central. SO easy, and cheap. Remember, tourists...GET on of those Octopus cards at an MTR station, and fill it up with credits, then hop on the trolly , and hop off at the front and slap that Octopus card against the reader, and you've got the cheapest, most fun ride ever. And Now, I have deemed them practical as well.

Must try for tourist and common transport for all short distances. I use it to go to and from work on many days. It's good for short distances like Central to Wanchai otherwise it takes a very long time. There is a stop every 200-300 meters or so.There is also a tourist tram where one can buy a ticket for a reasonable price and drive around if time is no issue.Nostalgic party trams can be booked too for few hours but they are expensive as you book the whole tram.
Great. A great way to travel on Central. Much more convenient than the MTR and more stops.Cheap and pay as you leave with Octopus.

Great way to experience Hong Kong. It's cheap to travel via the electric tram. It travels at a slow speed and is a good way to see Hong Kong and is especially good for tourists to explore the areas where the different trams bring you to. I will hop on different trams and be surprised with where it brings. This is an interesting way to experience Hong Kong.

Relaxing transport while sightseeing. The tram price is so cheap yet offering good service. However it has no air condition and tends to be quite hot in the afternoon. While on it you can enjoy sightseeing the towns in Hong Kong island.
Down to Earth - Explore the City. if you want to mingle with locals and see the city and neighberhoods from the street site, this is the ride you want to take.

Must take a trip on these traditional trams. Great views from the upstairs of these traditional narrow trams that run just East /West. Low price travel on these Ding Dings but can be slow especially at peak times when other buses and cars block the tramways.

Dinging the city. The Ding Ding is the cutest tram, It's non ac but worth every minute . During office hrs it might be congested but thats true of the train & busses as well.The standard fare is 2.3 HKD and hence its the cheapest mode of transport. The Ding DIng plies only with Hongkong

2.3 Hong Kong dollar tour. Did you get an Octopus card? See my MRT review. Use the card to pay for the tram. So for less than 0.5 USD you can go up and down the main strip. Get on in the back. Go up top and try to get a front seat. Then take in the city. When your done take a tram in the opposite direction. Be careful getting to and leaving the tram stop because the buses and cars come from the wrong direction

Great way to see HK. Great way to see HK and save the legs! Use the Octopus card. Very cheap. Sit upstairs and get some great photographs. Go the whole length of HK from East to West and back again. Not air conditioned.
Good old memories still kept very well.. Feel like old hong Kong in the middle of modern building and busy roads. A must try attraction in Hong Kong. Runs slow but who is in a hurry to go anywhere.

Public transport and a tourist attraction. Although a major tourist attraction the trams are a commonly used form of public transport for a very low price. Be mindful about when you decide to travel on a tram though, peak hour traffic and Hong Kong car drivers can cripple the network, what could be walked in 10 minutes could end up taking you 20-30 in a tram. The trams do not have air conditioning so make sure you take a bottle of water, and avoid riding on them during a torrential downpour or on super humid days. Tall riders may find it more comfortable standing up in the rear where you board the tram as it has the most headroom in the whole tram if you can't find a seat.
Ding Dings are very special;. From the upstairs seats we enjoyed our short ride through H.K. en route from our hotel (iClub Sheung Wan Hotel) to our place to eat for the evening (Gordon Ramsey's).
Only one negative. There is only one negative. Air Conditionng is available on all other public transit. Efficient. Ckean. Dependable. Fun.

Must do.. absolutely. I advice anyone to do this.. get on the tram at a point and head up to top deck and ride it out one way.. and then back the other.. its a great way to view HK from city centre around central/queensroad to kennedy (residential) or other way towards Times Square and beyond..

Good way to know Hong Kong and local life style. There is only one tramway in Hong Kong).It is on Hong Kong Island . The longest routing is from (from eastern,Shau Kei Wan to western side,Kennedy ),It only costs HKD2.3/trip,take the whole routing is around 1.5 hours). It is only one price. .You can aboard from any stop. Fyi, the tramway was built by the main road of Hong Kong Island,it is easy to get off if you get interest in any stops. You won't get lost Both Shau Kei Wan and Kennedy city is old residential area, suggest to take shorterrounting either from central to Kennedy or from Causeway bay to Shau Kei Wan, take about 45 mins. On both ways , you can see the modern and old areas so as to explore deeply how HK people in different life styles

Convenient and fun . I usually go from causeway Bay to Central for business reasons. The trams provide me a very convenient and easy transport. There is no need to waste time to go to underground for MTR as the tram stops are on the ground. Although buses can provide the same destination, the bus stops are different for different routes. You can hardly remember where the stop is unless you take the route everyday. The tram stops are fixed for all different routes.....easy for us who are nearly demented. In addition to convenience, the tramways is a classic way of travel in Hong Kong island and was built 100 years ago. You can enjoy the scenery and history of this traditional transport while you are on the tram. Good news is that air conditioned trams starts to provide service recently.

Unique and Cheap Travel. The Hong Kong Island Trams are a unique and cheap method of travel along the centre of the road to the east and west of Hong Kong central. For 15km you can travel for $2.30 (40c Aud) or $1.10 (20c Aud) They are narrow double decker vehicles. When it is raining you need to avoid open window areas particularly on the top deck. You can pay with coins ( no change is given!) or an octopus card (These can be used on trams,,trains, buses and most ferries). Octopus cards can be purchased at Metro Stations.

The DING DING. I enjoyed my ding ding ride. It shows you a different perspective of the city of Hong Kong. It's SLOW! but fun. If you have a group of people, you can rent a Ding Ding for a few hours. Totally worth it, as long as you have the right people people.

Good way to see Hong Kong .... ... From a street level. It may not be the fastest mode of transportation, but one of the best (apart from walking on foot) if you want to see island whereabouts. Cheap too.

Awesome way to see the city!. If it's raining or sunny it doesn't matter, these retro trams are delightful! I've spent a lot of time sat up the top hanging out the windows, watching HK and its world go buy, as I'm taking pictures.
Dirt cheap as well. HK is insanely expensive but there's things to do like this.

Great and inexpensive way to cut through Hong Kong. We used this method of transport on our last day and wish we did it earlier. It's a great and very economical way to travel around Hong Kong and makes a nice change from the MTR. Thank goodness the residents of Hong Kong voted to keep it going.

Fun and good value. I think in comparison with public transport in the UK, it is dirt cheap in Hong Kong and that doesn't mean the quality is not there either. For one trip on the tram, regardless of the distance an adult pays around 23p. Absolute madness for such a charming and traditional way to travel.

The most enjoyable way to travel on Hong Kong Island. This is our stand by mode of travel in town. Cost is only 2.3 Hong Kong Dollars or about .30cents US. It is very easy to figure out the routes and finding the stops you are looking for. A few tips are:1 grab a seat on the top level at the front, you not only get a great breeze to keep cool you also get the best views of town. 2) Avoid traveling at lunch time, trams get quite full and many times you will end up standing. 3) Make sure you close the windows when it rains...You will get wet.Sit back and enjoy, We have many times just hopped on and took the tram to the end... very enjoyable ride.
Must must do. Gtis us the best experince one can have in Hongkong. With the history that it has, taking the tram is an absolute must for all visitors.

See the Island a slow motion. The tram runs along the old seashore line, which is now extended at least a few blocks out as a result of land claims in the pass many many decades, of the Hong Kong Island. A lot of local people call it "Ding Ding". You can ask the beautiful ladies on the street where to get "Ding Ding" somehow if you couldn't spot the stop yourself. It costs HK$2.3 (~US$0.3) per trip and you pay, by either coins or Octopus the local e-money, when you get off the tram and thus don't look for the fee box when you get on.At the Tram stops, first look for a map explaining which stop you are at, and which line you should take. There is no difference that you get on a eastbound one or a westbound one, as long as it goes through the areas including Central, Wan Chai, Causeway Bay (I am counting eastbound); you just don't want to get on the one passed the key areas or with next stop being the terminal. However, if you want to see a more quite and older fashion of Hong Kong, take a westbound trip all the way to the terminate so to see the area generally call Sai Wan. For conservative ones, you won't get lost on this double deck vehicle as it only travels in the city and one should be able to find an MTR (local subway) station without difficulties at almost any Tram stop. Go to upper deck and enjoy the slow movement accompanied by the "Ding Ding" sound. All trams, but one as of today, are not air-conditioned. So, the street, the air, the building, everything is more accessible to passengers onboard a Tram. Don't just look at how close these trams can stack with each other, but also drop your eyes or cameras on the busy streets, appreciate the shops and people on the road, find the colourful lighted ad flashing right beside you, etc in such a packed city. You will find that you just had a most worthy US$0.3 ride ever when you get off the tram. It is a super experience for individuals, couples, family with teens or younger ones.

A nostalgic thrill ride. This may be a slow way of getting from one point to the next but when you're on vacation, why rush? The slow ride from the top level gives you a great perspective of the city landscape & landmarks plus you get to catch glimpses of Hongkong everyday life. Best of all, it gives you a bit of time travel to the past! Love the feeling!

Great way to see the city. The Tram is our favorite way to travel because its the cheapest and you can easily see shops or anywhere you want to jump off and explore. Sit on the top level in the front row seats. They have 1 new air conditioned tram with more coming.
Must try in Hong Kong. This transporation moves slowly around Hong Kong Isand. You can enjoy the street scene on the tram and expereince this dynamic city

Cheap, efficient, and fun mode of transportation!. Although MTR is a lot faster, I liked riding the ding ding because you get to see the sights outside! It can get pretty full sometimes though especially at lunch time.

iconic. A little thing to do if you are in Hong Kong - so iconic
Flat $2.40 per trip (no change given).
If you are going somewhere on the tram be alert - these get you to your destination faster than you think!
ps - how do they keep their public transportation so clean?

Just by 2.3 HK$ you can see many places. - clean and attractive
- well organised
- cheap
- just remember that the direction for going is not the same for return
- you can use octopus card

Throwback and great for sightseeing. The trams in Hong Kong are a throwback to an era before WWII or earllier. The routes are great on the east-west travel on the north part of hong Kong, and a leisurely and cheap way to see some of the major sights.

All aboard a (possibly) Glasgow tram. Cheap, fast, fun and with great views from the upper deck, not air conditioned but a cool way to get around. Don't forget to start to get off in good time as the decks can be packed, and the next stop some way past your destination. Takes MTR cards.
New Experience. If you come from a country where is is no double decker tram, then this is a new and traditional ride that should not be missed.
good experience. Experienced the earliest and environmentally way of transport in Hong Kong by paying HKD$2.30 for adult. Looking around the places and enjoyed the views. Definitely worth it.

Interesting!. Get on the tram from the back without tapping your Octopus card first and you can enjoy more sights on the second storey on the tram! Seats are narrow though.. Payment at the front exit of the tram.. Very cheap fare, only HKD 2.30 each trip, good alternative to MTR if staying in Hong Kong Island.
One for the kids.. Fun and better than travelling underground. Gives you the opportunity to see when to get off and back on.

Historic Ride. It is worth experiencing an HK tram ride.Take the upper deck and choose an off peak time to avoid the crowds and site in the front if the seats are available.Have your camera ready to take pics of the street scenes.Slow but the tram stops at all the right places and it is fun.Make sure you have the correct coins for the fare - no change given.

A must do on Hong Kong island. They are noisy and they can be cramped (at busy times) but for a very little amount of money (small change really) you get a timeless Hong Kong experience as they rattle down the street through all the sites, lights and smells of Hong Kong island. Naturally the best views are from up stairs at the front but there's no better way to see the busy HK island from end to end.

Transport the old fashioned way. I caught the MTR right out to Kennedy town which is the last stop on one of the MTR routes in Hong Kong. I then caught the team from Kennedy town right through to Causeway Bay as this was the original route when it was first built. I sat up on the top deck of the tram at the front and took loads of photos as the tram wound its way through each town to Causeway Bay. The tram is only around Hk$2.00 and is an extremely cheap and fun way to see Hong Kong city. I would highly recommend this trip. This train has been running the same group for 110 years - wow!

fun way to see everday life in Hong Kong. Great way to see everday life in Hong Kong at a good pace. Recommend to go top floor .take the train from beginning and end several routes.. can get off anywhere you like use your opal card when you get off. Cheap and relaxing especially if travelling with large family. Very clean. If at centeral railway station one of the exits will lead you straight to them

Great Way to See Hong Kong. This is a great way to see Hong Kong Island if you've got time. You can take a seat on either the top deck or the bottom, and just hop off when there's something interesting you want to stop at. Admittedly, you'd have to pay again, but it's super cheap!And yes, you get on at the back and pay from the front with either coins or your Octopus card.

Just fantastic. So inexpensive to experience this fantastic piece of transport history. I got so overexcited at one point that I needed to be reminded by my daughter to keep my head inside the carriage! Timely advice, as there are only a couple of inches to spare as the cabs pass one another!! The trams also give some welcome breeze when the climate reaches high humidity.These and the star ferry provide great memories of Hong Kong, where old constantly meets new.

Easy, inexpensive, great way to see the city. This was a very inexpensive (about 25 cents US) way to see a bit of the city. You simply get on and find a fun seat on top (if you'd like) and enjoy people watching, seeing the buildings, hearing the buzz of the city, and just taking a 'load off' from all the walking you have probably been doing. It is not the best way to go from one place to another though as it does move slower than busses, MTR (subway) or taxis but it is fun to do at least once. They are all open-air but they have just put one with air-conditioning in service and may create more soon but again, there is only one for now. If you are here while it is hot out, It may be nicer to enjoy near the end of the afternoon as the shops around the island turn on their street-lit-signs and you can enjoy sitting longer as it could be more comfortable with the cooler temps. Please Note: Unlike with the busses or MTR, you pay as you get off (not sure why they do this) and it is helpful to have an Octopus card to do so but you can also pay with exact change (currently $2.30 HKD).

Trip down the history lane....track..... it's pretty much a must-do if you are someone who would want to get a true feel of the city and what it must have been like when tram would have been the main mode of (fast)transport. It is definitely one of the cheapest modes...compared to MTR, taxis, and even buses which I realized were rather expensive in certain routes. Definitely not the fastest and not air-conditioned either, the frequency is quite good - better than bus less than MTR.

A great view. The tram ride is so cheap and a great way to see the city from the top deck. We took the tram from the ferry terminal back to causeway way and it may have been about 50p . It was a great way to see highlights in the humid heat. Well worth it

Wonderful way to see the city. I never experienced London with the trams, but I guess that HK was modelled on them. The gentle rickety rackety swaying of the trams full with hot and sweaty folks - a real HK experience. Great view from the top
Great way to get around. Great way to get around and see the city if you are not in a hurry. Easy to use and fun too! You simply tap with your Octopus cars when you leave the tram - simples!

Love it. Took it near our hotel. Enjoy the scenary. Passenger have to board from back door and alight from front. Only hk $2 plus per ride and only pay when alighting with cash or octopus card. It's non aircon by the way.
Just love it. This is a great way of visiting Hong Kong for some area. If you like to feel the way people really live in a city you must try this at least once.

Great way to see Hong Kong. We bought an Oyster card for all public transport which included the trams. This is a cheap manner of seeing around Hong Kong. In fact we just started at a point and went to the end of the line and the following day took another line. Was able to see both the tourist areas and the local areas. Better than the get on get off bus and at under 5 dollars a trip far cheaper. Highly recommended

Worth a try. . While on Hong Kong Island we decided to take a ride on these old double decker trams that run from one end of the island to the other. They are a big part of Hong Kong history and a worthwhile experience whilst visiting. Although a lot of tourists ride them, they are there for a purpose, and that is to provide cheap public transportation for the residents and workers on the island. With that in mind, they can be quite full at times. They are not overly spacious and the seats are timber and are comfortable enough whilst getting off your feet for a while. It might take a little while before you can get a seat during busy periods, but most people only travel a few stops and are happy to stand to let others sit. All the tram stops have identification boards as well as on top of them, so identification is easy. We did a bit of research before traveling and checked out a few journey's on utube, so we could familiarize ourselves with the area we were visiting. Costs is extremely cheap. We used or Octopus cards for payment. We entered the station. Enter the tram at the rear door and exit out the front door. Scan your Octopus card as you exit. The fare is the same regardless of how long your journey is. If you are unsure of where to get off, like anywhere in Hong Kong, just stand there with a map open and somebody will come up to you to help you out.

No A/C, crowded but still...have to.... It is crowded, does NOT have A/C but then, its the closest you can get to "the life of suzie wang"....Take a ride, it is interesting ..and get off at WAN CHAI market, worth it...

Very Nice. I had 3 issues with them:1. I am too tall, and these things are not for tall people2. The seats are totally uncomfortable3. Speed - to slowOther than these, it is really nice, you can see Hong Kong, windows were down, feeling the breeze.An other plus is the price, this is the cheapest way to get around (2.30 hkd for a person, ~1.2 hkd for a child)
Authentic. Good chill and cheap way to visit the city, you meet the locals, can enjoy the different neighborhoods.

Enjoyable and affordable!. I'd highly recommend this for first-timers in HK. It is very affordable (compare to bus and MTR) and very enjoyable. The ride is also scenic. It traverses the main street in the island, passing through different districts so somehow you get to familiarize and orient yourself on the different areas.

Historic trams!. Another cheap way of getting around HK island at just 2.70$ flat rate for each journey. Make sure you head to the top deck and enjoy the views and the sights and sounds of the busy streets!

easy!. the transportation system of HK is organized and easy to understand but you need to know how to connect from one place to another. the tram experience is fun but dont expect that the drivers are nice, so make sure you know where to go and where to stop!

Nostalgic. If you are from the UK and have been to Blackpool then these are like the trams there. They seem to stop every 100 yards or so but for the small cost I would say they are a thing to do on HK island.

Charming for shorter journeys!. A really good way of explooring an area. Just hop on and take the stairs to the topfloos - from here you can spot whatever interest you. Then just hop off and discover that area!

Not for the tall people!. Convenient transport along the island.
Crowded and with low ceilings, but quite usable. Timetables were easy to understand.

Enjoy your trip. Start your journey on historic tram ,it has been running since 1904.In front of the tram they write down the tram numbers and the place that they go. It is very useful for the people who is travelling alone.
interesting. We included a brief journey as part of a longer trip. A good experience. Just make sure you know where to get off and how to reach your next point after gettin off.

Slow and relaxing. Amidst the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong there's a mode of transportation that took us Victoria Park in a relaxing, but quite slow manner. It's great for the kids, cause they love this mode of transportation. For us that have been accustomed to cars, motorcycles, and subway trains, this mode of transportation is a welcome change (just once in a while). Had a great time in the tram having discussions with the kids and family, and most of all the kids loved it so much. Not recommended if you're in such a hurry to reach a particular destination.

Efficient and convenient. The Tram is one of mode of transfer in Hong Kong. The tram is everywhere and there are lots of them going to a specific places, So make sure to look at the map before you travel. In term of space it is quite packed even though it has an up deck. At time it is slow due to they also follow the traffic rule.
好玩噹噹車. Good to try it when you visit to HK.This is a traditional transportation which is located HK Island.

Cheap as chips and best way to see downtown HK. It costs HK2.30...to go absolutely ANYWHERE on the HK Island side of the city. From Kennedy town through to Northpoint or beyond...past the race course at Happy Valley. Its by far and away the best value of transport in HK. However, dont be in a hurry. Being a tram the drawback is traffic lights and blocked intersections slowing you upSome pointers-1/. EXACT change or use your Octopus Card2/. Sit upstairs for the views and the cooling breeze during htese sweltering Summer days

"Ding Ding" - An Old & Traditional Mode of Transport. If you will try to experience tge tramways when visiting San Fancisco, then you shouldn't miss the Hong Kong Tramways. The tramways was built in the Hong Kong Island. There are stops in the Central District, the main Commercial Centre of Hong Kong, and in Wanchai and Causeway Bay, the famous area for entertainment and shopping. From the stop at the Central District, just take 3 to 5 minutes walk to the Star Ferry where you can just spend another 5 minutes to the Tsimshatsui pier, Kowloon (very cheap ferry ticket for travelling by a traditional ferry with long history, and good habour view on the way). The Tsimshatsui Pier is just next to the Ocean Terminal and the big Shopping Mall. It is also very near the Metro Station and Nathan Road, the businest and famous road for food and shoppong in Kowloon, and the Temple Street (the night market).
Nostalgic ride!. Nostalgic ride in town. Slow but its worth it as you slowly past through streetts as busy Hong Kong passes by. Take the upper deck to see all that is happening.

Nostalgic feel. Hong Kong Tramways has been serving the public for over 100 years. Even though it is not as fast or modernized as the MTR and buses, it is still a wonderful form of transportation, especially if you are not in a hurry.
It's a tram. Used in rush hour - very busy! Get on at the back and off at the front.... if you can make it past the standing passengers in time at your stop. Cheap cheap!

Cheap way to go around in Hong Kong. The Tramways in Hong Kong are a good way to go around in the city. Jump on and you only pay 2.3 HKD when you get of. If you just go a few blocks or to the end station the price is the same. The end station is clearly marked. A few coaches has been upgraded and now have air conditioning.

A must do!. I love travelling on the trams in HK! It is something we always do now and I think I have converted my wife as she seems to enjoy the trips as much as I do! It is a great way to see the city and very very cheap. 2.5 HK$ per trip however long your journey. Last time we went to Kennedy Town I-spyed a few bars and restaurants and went back later.
Hong Kong Tramways. It is a very good experience. We took at the Hongkong Supreme Court station right up to the end of the station where your pass through north point, central, wan chai district.

Exciting way to travel!. What an exciting way to travel, there's just something special about tram travel! We used the tram daily as they are very frequent and so handy to jump on and off at the many stops along the way.Whislt this is a fun way to travel I wouldn't use it if I were in a hurry in particular on a long trip.

Good ride but.... Once in hk its a must try tourist to-do thing but avoid trying in summer months, its sweaty & jammed packed like sardines. Avoid peak hours too where i was caught in a big traffic jam, yes traffic jam. Good, slow & cheap ride.
A must . Had to have a trip on these trams, it cost 25 Hong Kong dollars (25 pence ) British money each.We got on and had a trip along the line and back. Good fun and for the price well worth it.

I could ride Hong Kong's Trams all day. A must do in Hong Kong. Any visit to Hong Kong must include a ride on the Star Ferry between Kowloon and Hong Kong Island, and a ride one of of Hong Kong's famous trams on Hong Kong Island. I love the trams so much, I could ride them all day.Tips:1. Ride both during the day and night for a totally different experience.2. Sit upside at the front or back from the best view.3. If a tram is full, wait for the next one. The last thing you want to be doing is standing up, downstairs.4. Have the correct money and pay as you get off,
Relaxing Ride. Taking a ride on the tram allows to see the interesting daily life of Hong Kong people. From old buildings to high-rise office buildings, it was a magnificent view.

Easiest and cheapest way to see Hong Kong. There are only Eastbound and Westbound. As long as you get your direction right, you can never go wrong.In less than US$0.40, the tram takes you to many attractions and shopping including Central, Peak Tram Station, Causeway Bay; or to the far east with very local neighborhoods. It has no air-conditioning but you may enjoy the natural breeze and hear the buzz of locals' everyday life. The upper deck would have better view. As a local, I still enjoy every single journey. Aka "Ding Ding'. Highly recommend for couples as a romantic ride or families with children to get a flavor of one of the oldest transportation in Hong Kong.

Fun for everyone . On the Hong Kong side just go to your nearest stop and look at the timetable board for your destination and tram number then just wait for the tram. You can use your octopus card enter towards the back of the tram then exit at the front. If your at the top section before your stop make your way to the bottom front of the tram. Beware the trams can be a little uncomfortable as they have wooden seats.

Regular tram rides during dayoff.... So efficient and will mannered drivers they have...if you felt confused your destination;once you asked the driver;they will answered patiently...i love dingding rides especially if i'm not in a hurry to reach my destination...
A must do!. Excellent views...try to avoid the queue by purchasing your tickets in advance to save time. The old tram is quite unique.

Dirt cheap mode od transport. If you are not in hurry this is a must do in HK. I am a fan of team and I loved the way this urban city has still maintained this age old mode of transport. People do love this as I could see even locals still using that.

CLASSIC TIMELESS HONG KONG Journey for 30 cents. Great way to see Hong Kong especially between Kennedy town to Causeway Bay......NO air conditioning from 100 year old trams. Open windows great air.....sometimes crowded; wait for the 2nd or 3rd tram to arrive less crowded upstairs seating is the best for seating and views.Slow in the daytime but great for people watching through Sheung Wan, Central, Wan Chai to Causeway Bay.Trams are less crowded and actually fairly quick from 7 PM on as there is less city traffic and the work crowd is gone

Fun but never in Summer!. One of the cheapest way to see Hong Kong from East to West or vice versa. Sit upstairs for a good view. Definitely, however, do not take it during the summer... way too hot with no air conditioning!
Do not miss these. The trams are noisy, old, clunky and great to ride hop on hop off and use your Octopus Card from ant MTR station - cheap as chips!
Interesting experience. My wife enjoyed her 1st experience on the Ding Ding. Only that it was a hot July afternoon, otherwise it would been a great experience to Causeway Bay
Great trip to experience true Hong Kong. Go from one end to the other on the Top Deck to really experience Hong Kong, great to see the hustle and bustle of the city for so cheap

Great way to spend an Hour. What a great way to see parts of Hong Kong Island on an open top double decker tram, there is a multi language commentary that gives you the history and information on the areas you are passing through, interesting and informative, a great little tour lasts an hour. would recommend this to anyone visiting.
experience. they sad it is the oldest public transport there. really cheap only 2 HKD. no AC tho and it was summer
A fun ride. Those who have time on hand must take a ride in the tram. Even if time is short, a ride in the tram is a "must" in the "things to do".

Explore HK Island via Ding Ding Tram. I'm glad I discovered the Tram. It traverses the length of HK Island East to West and vice versa with a loop servive to the Racecourse and Happy Valley. Every trip, no maater how matter how far or near, is just HKD 2.30.Use the Octopus card or you'll have to foot the exact amount in cash. Board the tram from the back and when you alight at the front, tap your card or pay in cash. Do go up to the secknd deck. Uou can see yhe sights and feel the wind in your face.
If you have the time this is the way to go!. Yes, they are slow but they do give you a real perspective as you travel along. On the MTR you will see nothing! YMMV
Ding Ding. This is one way to travel on HK Island and it is a great way. What ever the distance, adults pay $ 2.30. So keep change coins in your pocket to pay the DingDing.
Cheap transportation. Cheap mode of transport. Interesting for one who has never taken trams before. Boarding is from the back of the tram, and you only pay when you alight from the front.

Classic and Cheap. Used this tram to commute around Hong Kong island is my number one preference. You can see many people and activities along the way. It is also cheaper if we compare to bus and MTR. Consider using the tram if you see your destination nearby the ding ding station

best way to experience Hong Kong. Take the tram from one end to the other. Takes about an hour and a half, but it is the best and cheapest way to experience Hong Kong. Costs just 2.80. Warning - no airconditioning
Great way to see the city. These little trolleys are a great way to ride through Central. Hop up to the second floor to get a better view around street traffic.

Avoid During Peak Hours. Riding the Tram is cheap and a good way to see the city. However, it can get crowded at certain stops during peak hours. It doesn't have AC so it can get hot especially during summer.
Novelty travel. Worth a one off trip to the happy valley racecourse. Interesting route through shop lined streets, and great to see where to potentially disembark

Hong Kong Tramways. This is a fun thing to do. Suggest going up on top to get a better view of the different areas in Hong Kong. It is an inexpensive way of getting around the city and getting to know the sites.
London Double deck bus as Tramway. London Double deck bus as Tramway but in Asia, very cool to discover the city and fresh air without AC

Cheapest way to see the Island end to end and diversity!. Grew up riding this to school and now back to enjoy the ride from Central to North Point. A lot of history about the tram and a must do activity in HK given it's unique in the world. You go through various neighborhoods on the Island especially when viewing from upper deck. Not air conditioned so bring a fan in the summer! It remains the cheapest ride and activity to do in HK. Hop on and ride from one end to the other. You see many different facets of HK lives especially on a Sunday when the Filipino community congregates at Central and Indonesian community gathers at Causeway Bay and Victoria Park area. Fascinating experience
BEST THINGS. This is one of the things that you need to ride, tram is Hongkong island speciality, without the tram, no more unique hongkong.

The cheapest way to travel in HK Island. If you are staying at HK Island, do consider using their HK Tramway as it's the cheapest transportation (HKD2.30 one journey). You can also download tram map to help you plan your journey.

Cheap fun with great views. We sat on the tram for about an hour during the evening taking in the sights. The top level offered the best views and the breeze felt great through the open windows. This is cheap entertainment in Hong Kong! Really good value.

Old, slow but what a ride!. We had a lot of time to kill awaiting hotel checkin so we boarded one of the trams, took seats on the top floor and enjoyed the ride. It's slow, loud, hot but very cheap and goes along almost the whole Hong Kong island so you can use it to get to a lot of attractions. Fully recommended experience.

Fun way to get around. This was a fun way to get around the island. The trams look pretty but can get over crowded. They were very cheap no matter how far you go. You get on at the back and off at the front paying on your way off. Small change is required and be aware you don't get change so as close to the correct amount as possible is advised.
Old is gold. As it is said old is gold, same applies for this. Keeping the old tradition in the modern city. Had fun while traveling. Very cheap and fun packed.

Blast from the past ride . Double decker busses are well known but two decker tram is unique. For tourist I would say that not that Nancy way to travel but as an experience wonderfull. Make sure to go to the upper deck. Be ware that payment at the exit is done to a box, no return is given so take coins ready to when heading out.
One of the cheapest transportation in Hong Kong. One of the cheapest and convenient transportation in Hong Kong Island. Only 2.3 Hong Kong dollar per ride. It's a great way to explore the city.
Old School Hong Kong!. The best way to experience the cultural traditions of Hong Kong!! It's a fun, inexpensive ride. Best seats are on the second floor of the tram!

Best of HK Transportation for Tourist. If you're going to stay on Hong Kong Island. This is the best transportation for you. It's cheap, it practically stop at almost everywhere thus no need the long distance walk, you can enjoy the scenery while at it. Experiencing one of HK oldest transportation.They also test run a full air cond tram this summer.Visit their website for more info.Enjoy Hong Kong.

Great Experience. We stayed very close to a tram stop so we found it a good transport option. On our first day in HK we travelled it to Get our bearings.It was very interesting looking at the sights & the locals going about their business.It you go onto Hong Kong Tramways website they give you sightseeing suggestions at stops. It is very cheap $2.30 HK$.We found we used it a lot during our week in HK.Tip: if you sit upstairs you will get a great view. There is no air con but the breeze through the windows is enough to cool you down.

Great way to see the city!!. Very cheap to ride, they offer a different view of the city, and you get to see the places you only read the names of on the MTR. The older trams don't have air con, but the breeze helps to get the temperature down. HK should not get rid of these!
Fun experience. Trams are running continuously during the day! Its very convenient public transport if you have short distance trips. However, try to avoid rush hours!

Quick and easy transport between Central and Wan Chai. The trams are frequent and stop at most traffic lights. it is super easy to catch and faster for a few stops than catching a MTR. (less walking to access the train than to jump onto a tram)

Cheap & charming way to explore HK. If you are a HK drama fan, you would probably get a cheap thrill of travelling on the HK tram. Its truely a charming and romantic way to explore the city length of HK island.
It is terribly cheap and thoroughly convenient mode of transport.
Not meant for ppl with bulky luggages.

Air-Condition Free Ride, Low Fee . Must try this out an old transport from 1904. The tram fee is around 0.25-0.30 US dollar per ride. The speed is decent for you to enjoy the city light across the city.Tram is operated without the air-condition and make sure you get the seat in front so that you can enjoy the view. There are six line only so check where to go before you get on.
Cheap, convenient and folklore. A cheap and easy way to cross the Hong Kong island. a fun way to cross small distance you have to travel.
Worthy ride. Trams are only available on Hong Kong Island. Try short distance rides e.g. from causeway bay for local experience.

Another Must Do. Along with the Star Ferry and Victoria Peak, the trams are another 'must do'. It's one thing to look and photo the trams, but they really need to be ridden. It's easy, it's cheap and its useful... they can transport you from one end of downtown Hong Kong (Happy Valley) to the other (Western Market?). Meanwhile you get a good appreciation - especially if you go to the top deck - of shops, traffic, people and Hong Kong life generally. Plus, its fun!Missing your stop isn't fatal, you can always get the next stop and walk back, but it helps to move reasonably quickly before the tram stops at your desired stop.

Interesting and a cheap activity. It was a fun thing to do, except we went in the wrong direction... It is very cheap and great to go through the different neighbourhoods of Hong Kong Island. If you have time would recommend doing this.
The Cheap Fares Transports. Its really enjoyable...the perfect transportation for sightseeing!! The fares are really cheap and worth! Wonderful view from tram!!

Fun and cheap as chips. We rode the tram from Fortress Hill to Hong Kong Park. It was a great way to see the town. The tram moves at a leisurely pace and you feel like you've travelled back in time. We paid about 6 HK dollars for a 30min trip.

Wonderful way to explore Hongkong Island. A very cheap way to have a kind of sightseeing tour. Sit upstairs and go from one end of Hongkong Island to the other for only $2,30. Old school, original and charming.

unmissable. we got a tram from Hong Kong station to Happy Valley racecourse and back, you have to do it and be astonished at what you will see. Forget tours, just get a travel card and use the trams/buses/metro
Not so Great. the Tramway is on the road and runs very slow. However it a very cheap way to travel. Good way to see around if you have time.

love it. the team is the best way to get around hong kong.wasy to take..and very convenient the tram also gives you the chance to see hong kong..if youvtake the mtr you dont have these views of the city!!you can get on and off easily..also very cheap

Fun commute. Had time to spare so we took the tram from Causeway bay to Central. It is very cheap (HKD 2.30 if i remember correctly) and a great way to stroll along the busy main streets. I hope they continue to preserve this classic mode of transportation.

Crowded. Cheap (about 30 cents) way to get around, but very crowded. Pay attention to the front of the car and where it's going. We found ourselves headed to Happy Valley and that wasn't our destination. We got off and back on another headed in the right directions shortly. The wait is short.

Great way to get from Wan Chai to Central. Had a meeting in Central this morning - took the tram, perhaps the least expensive public transport I'm aware of!
For the best experience, I sit on the upper deck, at the front of the tram - everything is then, 'in my face!' Fantastic!
Slow but cool ride. One of the oldest tram systems this part of Asia, it's a cool way to go around HK island. I heard one can also rent these ding dings now for private functions like a party.

Trulyokd Hong Kong. Tram means a lot to local people. It's cheap, HK$2.7 flat fee for whatever route u take.
Superb if in cooler weather, i.e. Lower than 20 Degree Celsius because no air con and usually quite packed with people.
It's route cut across central Hong Kong Island. Particularly nice at night!
What an experience. Relatively efficient and provides ease to get around the city. Funny old trams but what an experience on these old trams.

great experience but not the fastes way to go. if you are tired of walking hop on the ding ding slow but authentic way to see the streets and experience the real old HK many locals take it and if you are only headed a few stops its a great way to go

The best transport in H.K.... Just jump on a tram and see Hong Kong go by.
Getting from A to B is easy.No need to be pushed around in the MTR or hassle for a cab.
Just jump on,enjoy and jump off.
Beware exact cash or Octopus card...

What a fun and inexpensive way to get your bearings and experience the culture. Enjoy riding the trams as an easy way to hop on and hop off. My advice is us the local travel card or have plenty of change handy

Harry Potter tram. Like the small tram in Harry Potter movies
Adorable. You can use your Octopus Card to pay. You can sit above. Nice view. We liked it a lot

Go on the beaten track. Most of your Hong Kong vacation will likely involve plenty of walking and sweating. So you might want to give your feet a break by sitting, relaxing, enjoying the breeze and watching the city pass leisurely by. That's what the Hong Kong tram is best for. Don't miss the opportunity to ride the full route from Kennedy Town to Shau Kei Wan. The cost is practically nil, your tired feet will thank you, and you can enjoy a dazzling 30-40 minute visual treat. The tram not the quickest way to get around, and that's the point. Some scenery is not meant to be seen from a speeding vehicle. If you spot something intriguing from the tram, you can spontaneously hop off at one of its many frequently-spaced stops.The tramway is Hong Kong's first mode of public transport and still uses the same route as when the service started in 1903, when the city was just a sleepy colonial outpost. It's hard for me not to get a bit nostalgic on the noisy and bumpy tram and ponder what Hong Kongers back then would think if they could see their city today.

Hong Kong's living history. I am always fascinated by Ding Ding, and it has been my favourite photograph elements in Hong Kong. I enjoyed watching them moving through the modern street and traffic like a time machine traveling from the past, solidifying the old Hong Kong with their presence for a magic moment, then throwing you back to reality.It preserves Hong Kong's history in a form that is still relevant today. I hope they can carry its unique heritage into long future.

Great classic HK transport. One of the oldest HK transportation systems, which runs along the belt of districts at the top of HK island. A must go, great views of city development of HK island, especially from the upper deck. Very cheap transportation fees, and family friendly too! Also a great way to travel between districts. Can also book a tram for a private tram party !

Saves you from lots of walking!. My husband and I didn't start using the "Ding Ding" trams until day 6 and we wish we would have started using them sooner. The only reason I didn't give them an "excellent" rating is because they are super crowded and not climate controlled- no fault of the Ding Ding. Buy an Octopus card right away and start using them as soon as you get there. You'll have more time and energy for sightseeing.
Awesome way to see Hong Kong island . The Ding Ding is an awesome way to see Hong Kong island and is really cheap $2.30 HKD per ride. Take in the views and explore if nothing else

Retrospective means of transport. The commercial part of the Island is well connected by the tramways for well over a century. The upper deck is where you could relish the streets of HK nice and slow. However, downside is that it might get crowded during the day and makes your climb up and down pretty hard especially with kids.
Cute but Slow. The Trams are a cheap way of getting around on Hong Kong Island. However, they can be very slow in peak times and can also be very crowded.
Must go!. Don't miss this experience! It is so much fun to ride this one. Try to sit in the upper deck and watch Hong Kong. Amazing.
Fun. These trams are on Hong Kong Island and a good fast way to travel. They come along every few minutes so not long to wait.

Fun ride on the tram. Love taking Hong Kong trams as they weave through the narrow streets. You can choose to sit on the top deck or nearer the action at the bottom deck which is narrower. The Octopus smartcard can be used for the trams and mtr trains.
It is fun watching the streets as the trams pass through various neighbourhoods.

Enjoy the view with this!. This is considered as an icon of Hong Kong. Other than MTR, this also can bring you places and it is affordable though slower than MTR. One should try this just for the sake of it!
Bumpy, slow, fun. Not the most efficient or fast but it can be a fun way to get up and down the main road. I liked it and enjoy sight seeing this way. No aircon so hot in summer.
So convenient. Very easy to use and regularly run into the night. Cheap at 23p a ride and a refreshing way to look at the sights of Hong Kong. We used the daily.
Unique Transportation. This is something you rarely see anymore. If the opportunity arrises, I say use it . We did and enjoyed the ride. Easier then the bus on same route.

Quaint little trams. We took the tram ride all the way one way. Decided to do this to see the different areas. It's a very cheap way to see the different areas. Then if we saw something we could hop off and explore. Would recommend to hop on and take this ride. It's all open air and can get hot especially around peak times!
It was a real treat. Super inexpensive way to travel across Hong Kong island going east or west. Of course the view is better from the upper deck.

RIDE IT !!!. BUY THE "OCTOPUS" CARD...you get on the tram( back door) and place the card against a reader when getting off...at the driver's (front) end.. it goes along ALL of the island's "shore", will take you everywhere...

So quaint! But slow and hot!!. Love the HK trams, they look like the skinny bus in Harry Potter!! There seem to be a few air conditioned ones now, but overall, in June it was a hot experience travelling on them! You do get a great view from the top deck...Remember to get on the back door and off via the front door. Cost is $2.30 HK per trip, which at time of writing is about 40c Australian! Great value...

More convenient than MTR between Admiralty & Central. Definitely a good choice for a ride between Admiralty and Central, faster way with cheapest fare,may experience the HK style transportation (ding ding tram way) like the cable car in San Francisco.

Excellent enjoyable time with Tram.... Anytime you can get tram inside of HK island and whatever its going just take it... Try upstair and first chair if available.. You can enjoy trip of the inside Hong Kong... You can rent it also for your private party... Its rally cool....

Must Try mode of transportation. They run along HK central, on Queensway Road, from one end to the other (this can be seen on the map) You can pay via octopus card or exact change and you can only get off at every stop. The ride was quite entertaining and quite affordable ( HKD 2.50) as an experience or in our case, getting from one building to the next.
A FUN way to experience Hong Kong, and cheap too :). Take upper deck seats and you'll experience the busiest street in Hong Kong like Wan Chai, Cause Way Bay and more. Enjoy!
Ding Ding. The best way and the cheapest way to see Hpng Kong Island is hop on the tram from one end to the other enad of the island. To see all the local suburbs and the local

Semi (Interesting & Sheap). In Hong Kong Island only (Not in Kowloon) ... From Ferry st. @ HKG island you can walk above the interesting long covered bridge until the end ... And then, you can ride it in 2nd. deck to see more.Fixed ticket fee = 1.20HK$ approx. you can see the map ... It consists of many lines most of them are overlapped & parallel to coast in the important streets &places to E. & W. directions

Nice and relaxed. its easy to get on one, just climb on the back. Get a seat at the top and relax while you enjoy the view of HK streets and culture. Its very cheap, just swipe Octopus card when getting off.

Felt like a kid.. was fun. I boarded the tram in Hong Kong island while exploring the city. It was really fun to experience it as I had always wanted to sit in one. Peaceful and a lot of oldies from Hong Kong in it. Make sure to carry change when boarding it as it requires you to pay the exact change when stepping down the tram.

Ding Ding. I hadn't been on a Tram on my previous visits so this time, despite rain And locals advice to use a taxi, I jumped on board and I think it's a great way to see the main route and the hassle and bustle of Hong Kong. The trips are 2.30 Hk dollars and it is exact fare, which I ddint have but the driver took my 2.05 Andy let me off the rest. The seats are wet if raining and the trams are not water tight, but wipe you seat and enjoy the view and the locals who predominate.
BEAUT. A must do when on Hong Kong Island - we always stay in Kowloon and train or ferry to/from Hong Kong.
Clang Clang. Hop on a trolley, go upstairs and work your way to the front seats. It is an amazing way to experience all that is HK, without the touristy feel

Really Something!. This is a must if you visit Hong Kong, it's quite a ride and a feat of engineering with regards to the gradients on the upward journey, especially if you have to stop mid way - praying you don't slide back down due to gravity! The views and trickery on the eye and brain is interesting as you move up the peak, look out for it!!!

We loved the Tram rides. This is so much fun.The Tram is cheap its one set price for any journey. Long or shortYou are never stuck in traffic and its so slow, great for seeing the streets.They come every few minutes and are most of the time packed.It can be hard to find a seat on the wooden benches.You pay cash ( exact amount ) or swipe your octopus card when leaving the Train.We also saw and read that you can hire a Tram for Birthdays, weddings......It was nicely decorated
Affordable!. You can see some part of HK through this tram with only HKD 3,3. I took all way from Kennedy to Happy Valley. If you never been to HK before, this is a must.

Must Try. I had to try and experience the Tram journey - they are very small with not many seats - however there is one every two or three minutes. They go very slow and is a good medium to view the streets of Hong Kong. They are VERY cheap as well.

Fun :). One of the cheapest modes of transport, mostly can be used to go faster down the road you were already walking down.It was fast and feels like a ride in an amusement park for a couple of minutesSimple hop on hop off concept

Cool thing to feel like you have travelled back in time . We hopped into the tram nearest to our hotel and went a few suburbs. The seats weren't very comfortable but that was part of the fun. You can only pay with cash and you need the exact amount which we didn't know so we just put in $10HKD cause it was a cool experience. Loved how there was no windows in the tram so the breeze came straight in - as well as the fishy smells that seem to be in some places of Hong Kong!!

Cheapest Way to Explore Hong Kong Island. For only US$0.30 or Euro$0.26, you can explore the lively activities of Hong Kong Island. Please make sure you have Hong Kong dollar coins $2.30 ready (pay when you disembark). Hop on any tram, take a seat on the upper deck, relax and enjoy the view of the busy streets. If you have time, try to pick the tram that goes to Kennedy Town (listed at the front of the tram). Kennedy Town still maintains some of the buildings at early 50s which is more interesting. Hop out when you have enough. Take a taxi to your next point of interest.
Charming and effective. The wood-bodied double-decker trolleys are fun and get you where you need to go! One unusual process is that you pay when you get off, not when you get on.

must try if you plan on sightseeing around the HK island!. it was a nice ride, especially if you want to go sightseeing with the tram along the central are (HK island). just make sure you pick the right one (decide you should go eastbound or westbound before getting on the tram), but no worries if you took the wrong one (which I did the first time), you can just get off at the nearest stop and don't forget to tap your Octopus card at the reader near the exit in the front part of the tram (you get on it through the back). Tariff is only 2.3 dollars.P.S: better view of the city if you sit on the top deck!

A must ride in HK. When in HK you have to take a ride with the HK Tramways, popular called Ding Ding. You enter in the back of the tram, and pay in front when leaving it. Remember to have excact Money as you are not given any change back. The trip cost HKD 2,30 - cheapride.

Best way to experience Hong Kong at street level. Pick a start point away from the city centre to ensure you get a seat on the top deck at the front. Pull the windows down to get good ventilation (there is no aircon on these old trams), and take in the views. Ride the tram all the way through the downtown district so you experience both the old area and the glitzy skyscrapers. Finally pay the $2.50 on departure or swipe your Octopus card. Now that is a cheap tourist attraction.

A Relaxing Way to Cross Hong Kong island. If you have the time , take the tran from one end to the other. This tide is especially beautiful at night but also provides a great orientation during a daytime ride. The complete ride across the island takes about three hours, but is well worth it for the couple dollars it costs. Be sure and sit up top.

It's basically free. Make sure you have small change before you get on. I don't think the machine gives change if you pay too much.It is very cheap to ride along for a few stops and ride back. Worth fitting it in if you can.

Great way to see HK. I'm a huge lover of the old tramways. Probably best to take out of peak time as it can get very busy and hot. Every time I have guests visit I always try to take them on a trip from 1 end to the other. Cost 1 way is $2.30 and don't give change so make sure u have correct money. Try to grab a set upstairs at the front of the tram for best view.

Going back a hundred years.. Took this classic means of transportation through mainland Hong Kong to North Point. Sat up on the top deck and took in the sights of Hong Kong. A must experience as you go back in time and listen to the Ding Ding of the tram bell. This is where is gets its nick name. Very cheap and worth the trip.

Good fun, cheap but very slow. The MTR was having a problem so I jumped on a tram at Admiralty to take me home to Quarry Bay.very cheap at HK$23 but it took over an hour to get to Quarry bay and I have walked the distance in 75 minutes before.They are trailing trams with AC so may try again. My wife wants to experience a tram so no doubt we will use them again.

A Great Experience and a MUST if you get chance. Quite difficult to work out when and where to get off once you are on but a great experience. Make sure to ask someone that actually knows and understands where you are going or you will get differing views. The trams are such an icon, it really disappoints me that Manchester, England has decided to introduce new style flexi trams. These old style modes of transport provide fast, effective and at the same time fun ways of viewing parts of Hong Kong.

The Tram is a good and cheap way to get around. As a tourist, The Tram is a fantastic way to get around cheaply while afford a good view of the city from the Tram with plenty of oncoming wind in the cabin. At an 2.3HKD/trip (June 2016), it is an really cheap way to get around Hongkong and see things. My girlfriend and I even took the Tram to the terminal and back so that we can explore the scenery in Hongkong. A must go.

Loved it!!!. Unlike the amazing MTR, this mode of transportation travels above ground, and a bit slower as well. But here lies the fun- for 2.3$hk, you get to see the city you ussually travel under. When you use tge mtr, you enter a hole in the ground, and exit thru another. Here, you see where you go, and in slower pace. And its sooooo much fun. As you enter, climb straight up to the second floor, sit by the window and enjoy. Ride the full length of the line and then comeback again. Why? Coz its fun!I loved it!

Affordable and Fun. One of the Hong Kong attractions, You can explore Hong Kong Island from West to East. You will find what Hong Kong's like with this old style tram, i was ride from Causeway bay to Kenneddy Town and I saw many thing. If you plan to go to Hong Kong, Ding ding Tram must on Your Plan.
Simply love them. ok, they are not fast but its like a siteseeing tour -> just cheaper and also more basic. just great

A good way tose Hongkong. These old tram some of which have been around for a century ar double deckers and travel slowly so you get to see the shops and building at a great pace. worth doing if you have the time.
Worth ago. Catch any tram and take a ride around the city for 1.30 dollar each, sit on the top deck. Get on at the back and off at the front/pay

MUST in HONKONG. Take it on 1st day to know about hong kong
its history , population, etc etc.
GET THE BEST PLACES MARKED ON YOUR MAP , BEST way to hip on hop on those places .
Unforgettable experience.. The best way to discover Hongkong. You can meet interesting people and see real HK lifestyle. The best seats are on the upper deck, of course.

Invisible time travelling tourist from the past.... Along with the star ferry, and cable car up to Victoria Peak, this is the other 'old world' way of travelling around HK Island and, if you are not in a hurry, or want to get a real sense of life on the island, then it's a real treat.As the tram trundles through the streets, with the hustle and bustle of the locals and tourists around, it's a great way to people watch and get a sense of the modern HK.From your sedate, original tram surroundings, it's almost like you become an invisible time traveller from the past, as you travel through because the locals are so used to the trams, they just get on with their business - so you can get some amazing photos of street life without feeling like you're imposing.You can use your octopus and given that it's only 2.3 HKD then you can hop on and off without him racking up a huge bill.I used it to go from Central to the races at Happy Valley, and it was a great way of arriving at the venue, but make sure you allow plenty of time!

Must do if you are tourist in HK. I take the tram nearly every other day to get around town.It used to be even cheaper like USD 10c to take a ride even from the west most tip of HK island all the way out east for 2 hour ride. Try to wait for a tram that's not that busy and sit out the 1/f where it's wonderful ppl watching. The best routes are around Happy Valley and out west towards Kennedy town both routes won't be as stuck under traffic. You also get to see much Hk buildings and icons.
Kids love it. This is not the best mode of transportation if you're in a rush but it's very cheap Causeway Bay & environs and is quite fun!

Cheaper rides and got to see beautiful view around the city. My son really love the tram ride. Everytime we are in hongkong must ride this trams to go around the city. Very easy and convenient. We can enjoy the view of the city too. The price is much cheaper the mtr.

No need to ride end to end. This is an icon of Hong Kong transportation (Star Ferry an Peak Tram being the other two) and provides some nice vantage points as you amble down the streets. I finally made the ride from one end (Whitty Street) to the other (ShauKeiWan) and can only say that it is an ordeal. About 2 hours each way and a lot is repetitive. Unles you want to do it (including taking in the Happy Valley loop), the part between Western Market and Causeway Bay are the most iconic, with WanChai particularly so.Just not the same for those who knew the "old" Hong Kong.

A taste of history. If you are not in a rush and if you want to get a taste of history, try the "Ding Ding" in Hong Kong Island. The track goes east-west and the journey only costs 2.30 HKD. They will introduce a few A/C trams in coming months. I do enjoy the fresh air in the conventional ones.
Take the Weight off. Catch a tram and see the city in style well rickety bumpy style but its just a great experience well worth the loose change .

See the parts of Hong Kong you normally don't. We hope on the tram to do a full loop on hong kong island which takes you also to some back roads and through a market depending which line you take. Suggest not to use the happy valley one though

Best way to enjoy the street view on the Island. With a long history and cheap fare, it's a must do on the Island. in the day and evening, the view you will see is superb. better ride the whole distance to understand the different districts. Visit Hong Kong Trams Station, a museum about the history of the Tram.
A Key Part Of Hong. They rattle, the are hot and humid in summer and often packed but they are a key part of the Hong Kong scene and a must if you are there.

Best value fun ride on the island. For hkd2.3 you can ride the width of HK island. I suggest you get on at one of terminal stations so you can get a good window seat preferably upstairs and ride to the other terminus. It is a leisurely trip with many traffic lights and stops and can get quite congested in certain areas. You only pay at the front when exiting.

Ding Ding - A must do. A really cool way to travel in Hong Kong. Jump on when you like, jump off when you like. Cheap easy and fun. They've been running for about 100 years so you're travelling on a bit of history. Some of them look and feel the same age. Either way its a great way to travel along the streets for a really different take on the city.
Trams. The trams are a good way to see Hong Kong Island on the Harbor Side, Every 2 minutes, Only $2.30 hkd ..........

The cheapest way to see the many sides of Hong Kong. If time always take the tram from any stop to Western and then all the way along the line to Chai Wan. Get a seat at the front and bring a camera to record the ever changing scenery. This has to be the cheapest way to see Hong Kong at just a few HK dollars each way.

Cheap mode to see Hong Kong. If you are just traveling along the route of the Ding Ding, go hop on on one! This is the cheapest means of transport.
Just ensure that you are on the right direction.

So fun!. We did this yesterday, a great way to get around! So cute. And cheap! $2.30hkd per trip no matter how long you ride for.
Get on at rear door and exit at front, taping Octopus card as you get off.

Experience the good old times of Hong Kong. Ding Ding trams network located in the main island of HK, grab a map or download it to make plan for your relax ride though the busy business district, experience the authentic streets of traditional shops as well as modern cafes and shopping centers. For best experience, avoid the rush hours and do it during the weekends

Cute and fun experience . The Ding Ding is always a neat experience to try out if you need to get from one point to another on the island. Rides are only 2.30 HKD and you get to experience a slower pace of a ride compared to the bus. Historically, they have been in existence for nearly 110 years. Definitely a must do at least once on the island. Not the most ideal if you have bulky luggage or baggage as the turnstiles where you board in the back are narrow. Exit from the front, and scan your Octopus card before you leave. Highly recommended experience.

A tourist must-do. This thing costs next to nothing to ride. You board from the "back" and pay as you exit from the "front". I find spring, fall and winter to be the best time to be riding the ding ding. Many locals go on romantic rides with their bf/gf in the past. Not sure if the new generation still does that. Not to be missed. You can also book the entire ding ding for events.
Its your good old tram, a dying breed. There are very few places in the world that still have trams. Its a blissful activity, moving in a slow pace in a fast paced city.

If in HK, you can't miss a ride on the Tramway!. It's an efficient, vintage, fun and delightfully fresh experience that every K visitor has to experience. Tramways are a good alternative to buses (more expensive) and MTR (which does not let you enjoy the beautiful HK surroundings). They are a very good alternative for a more economical and authentic sightseeing trip around the city. Must do!

Cheap and cheerful. I could travel on these all day. Such fun. At 23p for any journey it is great value. You hop on and pay when you leave. They are frequent and you can't get lost. Slower than a bus or taxi but ever so romantic.

Very easy & cheap... if you have time. It's very easy, convenient and cheap to use, above all for short trip.It's also very slow, there is no airconditionning, and very wet when it rains. Not adapted for kids stroller and disabled people.Note this is the only means of transport where you pay when leaving the tram (and not when you come in).You also can book a party tram in the evening to celebrate...

Charming!. It's as per the title, a very very charming ride. A ride that takes you completely across the city in a mere 2.30 HKD. Sit on the top deck and enjoy the city.
