For 2.30 HK$ you can go around on the Island, a bit shaky, a bit slowly and very old fashioned. But on upper deck you can get a nice view! - As tourist, do not forget your camera in nice weather.It is like going by tram in the 30ies! and the ceiling height is too narrow for me, so I should get a seat. But tram has its own flair, a great way to go on Hong Kong from one place to the other!If you could also take your way by subway in two stations, take better the tram: Half price, and mostly even faster! You do not need to go underground, get ticket, go one more level underground, wait for subway...You just get it at next tram station, mostly closer than next subway station, and you get a bit of sight seeing.For longer distances I'd prefer the Subway, just because of time consumption, but else? I'd prefer tram on Hong Kong Island.
Great Fun. A slower way to see the city. Not an essential part of your plan but still worth having a go on at $2.30HK per trip.
Moving Art. You have to experience the real yester years of travel on the trams. They have been running since the early 1900's and definitely a fun way to get around the main districts.

HK$2.30 for a 40 minute ride is a NO BRAINER!!!. The Good =)~Surprised why more than 10 local women were sitting with me inside this tram,all all these Chinese ladies were above the age of 70, why?Cause of the extreme low fare of 30cents(in US$) & I could see on the faces of all these old women the happiness they gained from saving money$$$ spending so little on a long journeyThe Bad =(~I think it DUMB to pay so little & suffer in the sweltering heat...go take a bus, its only a few cents more...~I think it dumber that the distance from 1 tram stop to the next is so short that i was wasting precious time when the bus drove at a speed of 90 km/h, here i was suffering at a maximum speed of 50 km/h =(My Tip for future visits:~DO NOT TAKE THE TRAM FOR MORE THAN THREE STOPS!

Tint Trams envoke an earlier era of Hong Kong Transport. We have found all Hong Kong Public Transport to be well run and cheap to use, particularly with the Octopus Travel card. Catching the tram - step on at the rear and work your way forward - are a delightful way to do some travelling. Can be a bit squishy during busy periods.

Get lost and have fun. Really fun to hop on board the tram and having no real idea where it will take you, theres so much to see so it doesnt really matter. Buy an Octopus card it works a payment on most tranport means.

A cheap and cheerful way to see lower Hong Kong island. Echo what others have said with it being a great way to watch the world go by.On one trip we went east from Happy Valley to the end at Chai Wan Road. Returning to Western Market took almost two hours so you certainly get your monies worth!The seats are rather hard for a longer trip and the 'air con' is whatever temperature the outside air is!You can use the Oyster card to pay for the trip and it's payment on exit.

amazing way take a city view. First experience with Hong Kong tram. its super cheap, about $2.30 HKD per trip no matter how far you travel without getting off. It's also very friendly. In our opinion, this is the best mode of transport if you want to watch the world move by at a slow pace, down the slope or vice versa. Very shaking but have a nice view at night time.Enjoy the panoramic from the double decker and make amazing photos.We loved it!Enjoy your experience!

Budget way to see HK city. Tram costs only HKD2.30 per way! I went to the nearest tram station from my hotel, took a tram and got to the furthest station. For better view and picture, try to get to the front seat of the upper deck :) The experience of sitting on a tram was interesting! I saw slumber people walking on the tram track while the tram got to stop by and gave way to them... For visitors, remember to prepare exact change for the ride as there will be no change for you... Do download the tramway map from their website before the ride so that you wont feel lost. Enjoy your ride! :)

Cheap & easy access to many places. It's a good choice if you are tiring of taking MRT in HK island. Easy access from central to Tung Lo Wan. For the price of HKD 2.30, you can enjoy the sights around, and easy to catch a tram and get down where ever you want.
Cheapest Hong Kong isand tour. Very cheap way to tour around Hong Kong island. Seeing different area of Hong Kong. Hop on, hop off anytime you want.

Cheap form of transport. Costs h$2.30 per ride and you can see a lot of attractions such as mid level escalators, wan chai markets, tram up to the peak. All tram stops are numbered and there is a map showing where the trams go and what stop to get off for the attractions, much cheaper than the mtr. Trams goe every 5 minutes.

What a cheap way to enjoy the sights. T his is a must when you come to Hong Kong and it is a great way to see the sights of Hong Kong in reasonable comfort. You can get on and off where ever you like as it is so cheap. You see so much from the top deck.

Memorable but not a good mode of transport.. I think it's a very a good experience and the good thing about it is you can use your Octopus card for it. You have to know which tram goes where and for me, I just travel from one MTR station to another but I chose to take the tram for that. Instead of travelling in a straight line between to points, it travels in circles before reaching the actual destination. The tram is old and open-aired and it's travelling at a very slow speed. It's almost equivalent to the speed of a person jogging or walking. But I think it's a unique experience after all and it can be a little bumpy.
Great for day just looking at sights. It was hot but upstairs at the front and its a sore ride after an hour..slow but very inexpensive and good way to see the sights

It's a must do. I often hop on the tram from Kennedy Town (Western part of HK Island) to Shau Kei Wan (Eastern part of HK Island) just to see which shop(s) remain operational or closed for business. It's such a relaxing thing to do and a good way to take a good look of HKI especially on a Sunday morning. The scenary is simply awesome and very rewarding. For less than HK$3, you get to see the real HK rather than being taking the subway. Highly recommend for all tourists to take advantage of this form of transportation. It's another alternative to take your date on a stroll especially in the autumn months. The best seats on the tram is the front section of the tram IMHO.
Love the view. This is the only way to go to the peakMust do watch the skyskrapers come and go as you head up at 45 degrees.

The experience not to be missed. Try the old trams, it is fascinating experience. You pay by Octapus card and its costs virtually nothing. If in a rush do not bother. You travel to gain an experience. Get on at the back, leave and pay at the front.

Great way to get a flavour of HK. This was the first thing we did in HK. Get up on top, sit at front and experience the city. We took the tram from Sheung Wan to Happy Valley and soaked up the sights - a great welcome.Oh, and it only costs pennies.
Great tourist experience. Cheap way to get around the city. Pay on exit. Flat fare anywhere. 2.30 HKD, 1.20 for seniors. Trams are frequent and efficient.

Aussie tripper. If you are an 'elder' i.e. over 65 you ride for 1.1HKD that's so cheap it is hard to calculate. Great way to see the city but you need a map to follow to know where you are or just get off when you feel like it.
Ding Ding was great. We went on 2 tram routes through various parts of HK Island each giving an insight to the HK culture
Noise and Bustle. These trams must be the best value for money anywhere in the world. What a great way to get around and see Hong Kong
Very Cute. The trams are very cute, the experience is truly awesome especially if your sitting on the upper deck of the tram. tourist should try that.
Not for everyone. I just love these open air trams - not to every ones taste though I dare say as they are not the most modern form of transport on the Island
nice old train. Tram's wooden interior make me feel like going back to the past.contrast with the modernity of hong kong building.exciting experience.

Cheapest ride, biggest value.. The tram system in one word is cheap, systematic and easy to understand (you either go east or west)...ok I lied, three words. Hahaha. A ride only cost $2.30 regardless of distance. Best way to digest everything Hong Kong in a short tram ride. Awesome!

Love it!. It's a cheap and fast way to take in the sights of Hong Kong. I like the fact that it goes through all the popular sightseeing and shopping places and you can travel the whole length of the route and back if you wish, for only 2 dollars!

This is Hong Kong ding ding. This is the ding ding city tram, only cost 2.30 for a ride and is very interesting if you not try this before. Tram can be busy but it is ok. Just go to middle of street at one of the ding ding stops and get on. If you can go to top it is best. Bring camera and get some nice pictures of the streets in Causeway Bay and Sheung Wan if you stay on for long time. Enjoy the ding ding.

Good but watch the weather. I missed the tram to the top of HK this year although its a must see.Just be carefull on the weather as last time I went up there was no view and the weather was the perfect storm!Shops were great.
Great for short trips.... Beats walking on pavement, just avoid peak hours and you'll be fine. At a flat rate of HK$2.3 it's great.

A local experience not to be missed. The tramways have two decks - sit on the upper one towards the front for great views en route to your destination. It can be packed during peak hours, and be careful to close the windows when it rains... But it's also a great experience that allows you to rub shoulders with the locals :)
warm but fun. Plenty of trams scuttle along the island on HK side. go upstairs for a bit more breeze as the windows will be open. use your octopuss card when you exit the tram. pre-defined stops.

Tram Up the Mountain. A little scary until you realize that the tram is pulled by cables. Beautiful views in all directions at the top and lots of eating choices. There is also shopping available as there is large mall. Best to go on a sunny day. It was overcast when we went up. Try to get on the right side of the tram going up, the view is much better from that side.

tramway is a great way to get around hong kong. cheap, runs quite often, and gives you a good way to see part of the city. sometimes very crowded, watch your belongings. Also, you enter in the back and get off the front, so watch your stop so you don't miss it.

Great way to see HK island. Great way to see HK island. Fantastic during the colder months of Oct, Nov, Dec...
No aircon so during Aug, Sept it is difficult but still worthwhile.

Get the upper deck first row!. If you are too tired to walk the long corridors of metro, do not want to wait for a bus, do not want to spend on taxi or just want to have a try like us, do not hesitate go on a ride!!! Catch a seat on the upper deck first row. for photo taking especially, it is a perfect location as the front windows are operable.

Cheap, brilliant way to see and get around HK.. The trams are a great way to get around HK. First of all they are very cheap. Buy an octopus card at the train station and then you don't have to worry about looking for loose change. Get on the back, pay up front when you get off. The top deck gives you a better view of the sights as you cruise the streets. We took the tram over and over as its way better and cheaper than subway.

Ride the HK Tram. What a great way to see HK life. Get on the Tram, go to the upper deck and you've got the best view of HK for the cost of the ride. Have fun. Just remember where you got on so that when you take the return ride, you know where to get off. But travel on the HK Island is so easy. If you're lost, just use your Octupus Card, go into the metro and go back to your location. It's the best system in the world and the cleanest. I think that's because they don't allow food or drink in their Metro

Great way to get around. The trams in Hong Kong are cheap, very regular and a very good way to get orientated on your first day. It was great fun travelling by tram and really easy to understand routes etc. Highly recommended.
the Old days are back. Greta fun to be abck on a tram , everyone on it seemed very happy locals and visitors alight and its very very cheap , have a go youll love it.

OLD BUMPY but SUPERV!!!. You can see HK way of life almost for free (2.30HKD). This is not good if you're in a hurry or have some osteoporosis. Avoid if your weight is above 260ilbs.....you might be able to enter the rotating bar gate...:-)
Tramways -Hong Kong. A cheap travel option for getting around Central Hong Kong. Also, great view from the upper level allowing for good photo opportunities.
Terrific Tams. The trams proved a fun and inexpensive way to get around and to soak up the ambience of Hong Kong island. Don't fail to try them. Upper deck is the place to be.
Efficient and Cheap. Only at HKD2.30 per adult and you can travel from Kennedy Town to Shau Kei Wan. Worth the try if you are not rushing.

Tour Hong Kong for only HKD2.3 (USD 0.30). The tram line from western terminus of Kennedy Town to eastern terminus of Shaukeiwan passes through the main roads of Hong Kong Island's northern half.Board the tram from the rear. Get off at the front. Pay HKD2.3 regardless of distance. The tram will stop at all stations so there is no bell or buzzer to press. Service hours are from about 6am to 12 midnight, more or less.The tram will not go the entire length of the east-west route if the sign says Whitty Street Depot, Western Market, Causeway Bay, Shek Tong Tsoi and North Point.If you fancy an evening at the horse racing track, then most Wednesday evenings there will be races at Happy Valley from 7pm to nearly 11pm. Take the tram that says Happy Valley and get off at the terminus.

A must visit ride in Hong Kong. If you going up to the peak , the best is take the tram to go up and take the double decker bus and seat on the top floor to go down the hill. This is the only way to get the full experience.

The only way to travel. Whether a visitor or local this is a must and such a cheap way to travel. Only HK$2.30 about A$0.40 for as many stops as you want. You need exact money as no change is given or get yourself an octopus card which you can then use on the metro, buses and even in some of the stores. Very busy and you don't always get a seat especially on the upper deck but they appear with minutes and don't get caught in traffic like the taxis and buses.

Nice at night. If you're going to Hong Kong Island as a tourist, a ride on the Tram is a must. It's cheap - about US$0.35 for any distance, short or long. Take a seat on the upper level and enjoy watching Hong Kong clatter by.

At first it touristy, then it became useful!. We jumped on a tram with no idea where to get off, just to see the town for $2.3 dollars. After a few days we were using the trams to get along the width of Hong Kong nice and cheaply, always busy, always have people trying to get to and from work - but they appear all the time, and can be pretty quick if you get the traffic lights.

Not recommended during Hot/Cold days. best time to ride tram is when weather is warm and calm.Hot days and you sit with so many others sweating like a pig (I do, anyway). During busy times, which seems to be most of the day, there is a great push and shove to get on and off the tram. Contrary to what others say here (locals or others) this is NOT the best way to travel the northern route of HK Island. Better to take the busses, which are many and frequent, and A/C is complementary.The reviews from local HK Chinese are very funny! they recommend something they would never ride themselves (as most HK locals take MTR everywhere).For some reason the Pinays think it is an economical way to travel (slow, noisy and exposed to the heat or cold of the HK clime).
What a thrill. How exciting is it to sit up on the top floor and just watching the buildings going by while the tram trundles along the busy street's, give you a little look at yesteryear..
Nice little trip. Went over to Hong Kong Island and decided to try the trams. Very inexpensive and a nice way of getting about the main waterfront area. Get on find a seat and sit back and relax.

Simply the best way to see north coast of Hong Kong Island. Trams in Hong Kong are very special and tram ride is the best way to travel along the north coast of Hong Kong Island. The tramway was built along the coastal side of Hong Kong. However, due to the crazy reclamation of land in Hong Kong. The tramway is now far away from the seashore. Therefore, riding a tram can also enable you to know about some history of Hong Kong.The fare for Trams in Hong Kong is extremely cheap and you need to get on the tram at the rear door. When you get off the tram, you pay fare in front of the driver at the front door.It is advisable to sit on the front seat or rear seat of the tram on the upper floor. You will see great view of Hong Kong Island especially when the tram went under those fly-overs, bridges, and those hanging advertising boards.
Amazing queue management. what i really like in hong kong is the speed. even at queues its amazingly fast. you'll not be bored while taking the queue. as its so effective.

Great Way To See Hong Kong Island. The trams are one of the icons of the city and are a cheap and nostalgic way to travel around Hong Kong Island. Highly recommended to tourists as you can travel around the island at a leisurely pace and all for HK$2:30. If you visit, don't miss them!
A cheap way to enjoy the city. Hop in and just go around the city! It's just $2.80 no matter where you're going. Won't hurt your wallet at all. :)

Great and convenient transport. The tramways were a great, convenient way to get around the city. The challenge, as with anywhere, is figuring out which tram goes where. But they are well labeled with their destination, and if you have a map in your hand you can figure it out. Plus, Hong Kong residents are so friendly and helpful - one lady didn't know the answer to our question and started asking other people riding the tram for us. It was fun to get the upper deck view when we passed through the Causeway Bay area, and saw the tons of people out shopping. It was also a bit cooler, with the breezes blowing in through the open windows.Definitely use the trams when you visit Hong Kong.

Cheapest ride in the city. its the cheapest public transport ride in Hongkong island, but the slowest one too, but if you are just vacationista so its probably okay especially for just strolling around
The Knight bus!!!. These trams remind me of the Knight bus from Harry Potter because they are tall and thin. Great way to see the sights of HK, and cheap as chips (HK$2.3 per journey, however long)!

Easy and cheap. We used the trams to get around Hong Kong, granted not fast, but they give you a good view of the city. Great for exploring on a whim. Paying as you exit was an interesting concept. Highly recommend for any tourist.

loved it .... a must try.... this is a perfect way to explore the honk kong island on your very first day there ..... we took the tram from sheung wan and just loved the view from the top and checking out all the different places we had heard of and wanted to see .... gave us a very good idea as to how far apart they were and helped us plan our trip better....

Back in Time. Very enjoyable and easy way to travel. Using the MTR Smart card which can be used on all forms of Hong Kong Transport makes it even easier. Just jumped on and off, using the rear door to get on and front to exit. Very cheap and ideal for the tourist, used it to travel from near Man Mo Temple to the Lower Peak Terminus.

back to England. When I got into the tram I was carried away to old England with its narrow streets and double decker transportation. Tickets are cheap and you can pay before you leave.It's not speedy, but you can reach it at any time, no need to wait. I was great experience... like a touch of history

Must do activity. Enter the tram at a station stop from the rear. No need to pay. You pay as you exit, exact change or more (HK$2.30 or around USD $0.30), also the invaluable Octopus stored value card . Ride as far as you like to the end station. Best during the evening hours and not on a hot or humid dayThis is a great but slow way to take in the entirety of Hong Kong Island (literally 1+ hour from end to end) but hop on for a few nostalgic stops on something that won't likely be here in 20 years.

Cute skinny little double decker trams. Was heading for Causeway Bay train station when we found these gorgeous, skinny mini double decker trams, going just where we wanted to go. Squeezed in (go in the back door), went straight up stairs to enjoy the ride. Leave by the front door, and drop the money in the shute on your way out. Lots of trams, saw 5 lined up on the other line, bumper to bumper. They do a tiny U-turn at a roundabout at the end of the line.

Always Fun. This is a fun way to get up to the Peak from Central. A must if you are a visitor. Go on a clear day so you can enjoy the nice view across the harbor and take some good pics. There is touristy shopping only and a few good places to eat lunch

Best way to check out Hongkong island north side. At 2.3 HKD, you get to sit on top of an old world relic moving at its own pace and its own characteristic hoot in the middle of the road, giving you the best and unhurried views of the HK life around pretty much the north HK areas of Central, Wan Chai etc., Highly recommended as a tourist activity, though as a means of commuting, not that efficient.
Cheap way to get around Hong Kong. It was very convenient to get around Hong Kong with the tram, very cheap too! Only available on Hong Kong island though.

A unique Hong Kong experience. This is the only place where I have seen double-decker trams. Take one for as long a ride as you wish, then reverse. You will get a sense of Hong Kong neighborhoods and the second-floor perspective gives you a sense of life above the shops and street level.

Excellent way of seeing Hong Kong. It was such an amazing experience getting on the trams and the best way of seeing the other parts of the city. It is cheap and handy to hop on and off. We were not really sure which tram to take at first as the tram services really provide a wide area of HK. We then decided to take the one heading to the Northpoint. We got off at the last stop and we were surprised to see a morning market there. We grabbed the chance to look around and bought some cherries and plums. They were all cheap and fresh. We enjoyed the experienced of being closed to the locals and wondered around in the morning market.

Ride to the old city of Hongkong. This ride is not on the Kowloon side , but on the Hongkong island and runs from east to west on the Hongkong Island. The trams are double decker and moves in the central , wan chai and other areas of Hongkong Island. This mode of transport is unique in its own way.
Cheap and classic HK. Pretty easy and cheap way of getting around Hong Kong Island. Nice views from the top level and surprisingly breezy on hot days.

The best and cheapest way to see the city...Ding Ding!. We had the most amazing time all for around 20p!! We really didn't feel like queing for hours for the usual tourist attractions as we only had a couple of days. we just wanted to experience the city. We took the Star ferry accross the water from Kowloon and caught a tram going east to North Point, we sat on the top floor at the back, the best way to take photos. The trip to North point took around 35 minutes, when we got there the tram stopped for ten minutes and we stayed on, the cleaner came on but we just took in the atmosphere of the bust market street with food stalls that the tram had stopped on. After ten minutes or so the tran headed back westward to our origional stop. A great way to spend an hour seeing the real Hong Kong and it cost around 20p. (The seats are uncomfortable if plastic wearing shorts!)

very fine way of transport on HK island. clean, in time and nice way to mingle in the Hong Kong crowd, top way of Hk experience, ultra afoordable price, buy an Octopus public transport card and you can go anywhere in Hk
Seeing Hong Kong. Easy to reach - remember to have correct change - these tram trips are excellent value as way to see around areas of Hanog Kong

Best value adventure. For 2.30 HKD or 20p you can travel the length of the island, from Kennedy Town in the west. to Chai Wan in the East. Just take care that you pick the right tram, otherwise your journey will be short.

this is by far the best way to travel in Hong Kong. You have never visited Hong Kong if you do not ride this. cheap and chearful and goes a long way. If you ride from the main station you will get a good front seat

HKD 2.30 you cant beat that !. Upstairs on the tram in the front seats. Start in Central and go east as far as you like. It will take you past the new skyscrapers and designer stores of Central, the bars of Wan Chai, the plush shops of Causeway Bay and into the hustle and bustle of the local neighbourhood of North Point.

Cheap but excellence to have overall impression of hk. It costs only hk$2/ride or less than 1/5 euro per ride. Take the trams its terminus in North Point where you can find real hong kong (wet market and local residential area)
clean,,,fast,, efficient,,,. about 3 dollars and 50 cents takes you 5 stops,, then transfer for more,,,,this is the way to go,,not just budget,, but,, good travel
A Hong Kong classic you can't miss. The tramway has been around for decades and little is changed. It is slow and not air-conditioned. Take it if the weather is nice and you're not in a hurry.

One of the best ways to travel!. We never actually got to grips with where all the different trams went but we still had a great time hopping on and off. The trams are really cheap and a great way to get around Hong Kong. We frequently hopped on and off as we felt like it or as we needed to.You pay when you leave the tram and get on at the back. It was a fun and easy way to get through the busy streets.
a must do. easy cheap method of transport- you get to see more and take faboulous pictures as you move up and down the busy streets

Get on it!. I tried really hard studying the routes on the HK trams app, but still couldn't figure out which tram goes where. Since my kids really wanted to ride on this interesting 'long box', I decided to just hop on one in Causeway Bay. I had no idea where the tram was going , we just got off when we felt like it. Then we just followed the tracks and walked back to CWB. It was about an one hour walk with no crowded tourists, we saw an open air market with butchers selling meat hung on hooks, a small flower mart, a temple for locals... It was actually one of the best part of our trip. Go explore!

cheap. easy. unique.. Hop on, go as far as you want pay 23HK$. It is very easy to get around on the island with the tramways. We never waited long. We got some very nice views while driving around.
It is not the fastest way to get around but better than traffic. MTR is faster but it is a good alternative.
Great fun and cheap way to see HK. Always a good time on the trams going along the island. The 2.25 HKD fare makes it a cheap way to get around.

The best way to see HK street life. For a small fee, you can go on tram ride from Western Market right to the far end of the tram line. The journey is well over an hour and if time isn't a problem. Take the tram back to Western Market. I love the HK tram. You see all sorts of things going on, this is the real HK you see, sights, sounds and smells, warts and all. I've been on it during the day as well as at night and I do recommend it. I think HK is the only place on the planet that use double decked trams. A lot of these are very old and there's no air conditioning, but unlike the buses, you won't have annoying adverts played at you constantly.

Trammin' it up. Great day out if you want to see a bit of Hong Kong, do it on the cheap, hope on and hope off when you see a 7/11, grab some beers and try to catch some high 5's on the other passing trams. Admittedly the beer probably did make the day ALOT more fun than it would have been just riding round on a tram, but I would highly recommend it!

Use trams to get around HK island!. Very easy and cheap way to move around HK island. Trams come very often and you can usually fit in, even during rush hour. Use an Octopus card to pay so you dont have to have exact change.

soak it up!. i used to live in HK and go back every couple of years. there is nothing like occassionally escaping the hustle and bustle, and jusst watching it from the most efficient tramways. You can sit back, take some photos, get off at any spot and its next to impossible to get lost. If you do almost all the tram stops are near the MTR so just make your way back there.

Must do. There is nothing like taking time out to ride the tram along Hong Kong island. Great cultural and heritage experience...and cheap too! Love it. Go upstairs to get an open air view of the hubbub of the city.

Essential part of Hong Kongs heritage. From first glance the trams in Hong Kong don't look that special. That is because they are quite old fashioned but that is part of their charm and I hope they don't replace them for some of these modern city center trams.They are so cheap to travel on. First thing on a morning or late on an evening there are a great way to travel down main streets of Hong Kong. Avoid during mid day as will be busy with commuters and you would be unlikely to get a seat upstairs. Also watch out for the pushing culture in Hong Kong as you will get pushed and shoved getting on or if you stand too close to the exit or entrance.But while they are still in place in their current form they are well worth the time for a visit.DING DING
Cheap and efficient way to move and traditional looking. Everything nice but have coins well counted with you! You can have the 2 floors tramway and go back to one century ago

See Hong Kong in budget. If you take this ride very early in the morning, you'll see Hong Kong in their rush. And that's pretty nice attraction. The tram pass the main street in Hong Kong island, and you'll see most of the most crowded place in Hong Kong island like Central. Take the seat on second deck if you want to take pics.

A Hong Kong 'institution'....... The trams of Hong Kong are an ‘institution’. Next to a sturdy pair of feet and legs (or the MTR) the tram is great way to sit back, relax and link into where you wish to go across the city. If you have never ridden the trams of Hong Kong just do it! It is definitely one of those must do city experiences.

Cool. Tramway is just more than cool! Sometimes you feel it is going straight up and down! So excited! It does not run very fast, which give you a lot of time to see the view and feel the tram and the path!

Great fun, convenient, cheap. The tram is a great way to get around while observing local life. The only trick is to remember some visuals of your "home" stop, as well as the name, so that when you return home, you'll know when to get off.
Don't miss the trams. Love the trams on HK Island - don't go to HK without having a go! So cheap; a good way to get around the north part of the island or just go for a ride, good viewing too.
Fun and convenient. Not fast, not airconditioned but an experience not to be missed! Cheap and cheerful HK icons worth a ride.

Cheapest transportation in Hong Kong. It is the cheapest transportation in Hong Kong.It just HKD 2.2 per journey, but It only run in Hong Kong Island.When you stay in Western part of Hong Kong Island, it is the good way that using tram connect to MTR station or some hot spot in Hong Kong, such as Central, Causeway Bay.

Cheapest way to tour Hong Kong island. At around US$0.30 flat (yes - 30 cents!), the trams (aka "ding ding" because of the bells) are definitely the cheapest form of transportation and also doubles up as a mini tour of HK if you ride it from end-to-end, though not recommended as it's slow and the seats aren't the most comfy (if you even get a seat...). It's a must-try for a short distance and just for the experience. Be warned that there is no air conditioning so it can get quite smelly and uncomfortable during summertime, especially if there's a lot of people.

Tramway to Heaven - well almost!. The Peak Tram ride is a 'must do' tourist activity in Hong Kong. It only takes seven minutes to reach the peak but it is a scintillating short ride. Once you get to the top the views are fabulous. Only negative is the seat backs in the carriage are fixed so you sit backwards on the down journey.

For the experience. I brought by children to experience this. Its slow, rough, hard seats, muggy feeling (it was a hot day). But that was how transportation was a long time ago. (my kids preferred the subway because of the heat).

Hong Kong Tram. If you like nostalgia, then Hong Kong Tramways is a little bit special. Not only is it ridiculously affordable, but its a great way to see and get a real feel for the thriving island city.Just by taking the North Point to Queens 20-25 minute route you'll feel part of the history that has lived with Hong Kong. Even with the towering skyscrapers around you, there's a hint of what it was like, when you are aboard an 80 ( and more) year old tram.At night time its even more spectacular.A thoroughly rewarding cheap thrill.

Trams. The Trams are, from the roadside, quaint and sometimes beautiful. The decoration(advertising) is amazing covering everything under the sun. Travelling however is not so quaint. They are difficult at times to board especially with luggage, and are not all that comfortable to travel on, with wooden seats and a constant sway that ensures you get close to your fellow travellers. They are cheap, convenient and a must for all visitors to experience.

Cheap and easy way to get around. We used the tram to help us get to know the area and to see Hong Kong by night and by day. If you sit on the top level of the tram you get a better view and it is cooler up there. Make sure you are up from you seat and on the stairs ready to get out for you stop otherwise you could miss it. There is not too far between stops so if you do you can always walk back.

Historic, fun, cheap. An easy way to go back in time and visit Hong Kong Island main road back and forth. You can leave from downtown and go way west in (a bit more) more traditional areas. No aircon, so open the windows and open the street life of Hong Kong.
the3 best on all. wonderfull thing to do in hongkong 2.50 dollar for all day and the drivers are the best we ever seen thanks to them

A Fun Thing To Experience. A definite fun thing to experience, not sure if it still is but at one time it was the longest escalator (Outdoors) in the world, still seems like it must be, it goes on for what seems like forever, you can jump off anywhere to enjoy a cold one or a great food joint. Really well worth riding it, but do it at night time or on a weekend evening to really enjoy the atmosphere. Calm to Wild and Crazy on the Journey with everything in between. Safe environment all the way up.
Easy. Traveling around the city by subway, tram or bus was simple and cheap. We found it amazing that a city of 7 million people could move around the city so easily.

A Must!. Must try and it's a lovely experience. If you expect a fast tram, forget it. The pace it moves is just great for photography! Get an Octopus card that can be used for public transport and shops.
great journey. Mostly can reach the other side of the city nicely. only the tunnel walks too far for the route to the Hongkong Airport. and must buy the Octopus card for all access.
You have to give these old Trams a go!. Cheap and Very efficient - quite quaint. Bit of a hard ride. but for $HKD2.50 you cannot go wrong! Passengers pay by depositing the exact fare in coins.

Shake and shake.. First experience with Hong Kong tram. Very shaking but have a nice view at night time. The tradition tram ring sound Tong Tong Tong. The tram fees is very cheap. I feel quite dangerous cause other vehicle on the road is faster than tram. Good experience must try it.

A great way to see the city. The trams are a gret way of seeing Hong Kong island. for HKD$2.30 per trip, you can travel from one end to the other. Often busy during lunch times, it's best to go in the morning or afternoon to get a seat.

Fun way to see some of Hong Kong. A leisurely ride on the trams gives you a different view of Hong Kong ... Just an interesting ride or ride to North Point and wander around the markets there... Wet market as well as clothing shoes etc. you can use the MTR octopus card to get on the trams

A nice way to see a bit of Hong Kong island. If you have time and would like a slow journey across Hong Kong Island then I suggest you try out the trams! They are cheap and the newer ones are fully air conditioned. Grab a seat at the top and enjoy the ride :)

An E-Ticket Ride. If you are new to Hong Kong and want to see the city without worrying about being run over (by fellow humans or vehicles), the tram on Hong Kong Island offers an outstanding value. For just a bit of change, you can sit down and see and smell and hear the sights of the city as they flow slowly past. Some of my favorite tourist memories of this most amazing city were formed from the front seat of the top of a double-decker tram making its slow way across the island. A delightful way to relax and focus on the life of the streets.

Ding Ding, slow tram to China. We opted for a short trip on the trams, and it was lovely. However, being Sunday afternoon it was jammers with locals having a day out to. The value is extraordinary, $HKD2.30 for a tram ride!!! The views are great from the top deck and the stops are frequent and well spaced. Take a trip and enjoy the stroll down memory lane as busy HK idles past.
Cute tramway. Double deck tramways are a trademark of Hong Kong downtown. Always with a different ad on it. Recommendation!

Fun way to see the city. This is always a fun way to see the city. The only caveat we have is that, in the summer season, there is no escape from the heat and humidity as these cars are NOT air conditioned.But it was both fun and interesting to ride these historic cars. A four day pass can be purchased in advance and mailed to your home for about US$5! Great value!
Modernism in move. The best way to travel around HK. No killer aircon like in te cabs, and always there is a breeze on the move. Enjoy the panoramic from the doubledecker and make amazing photos.

A must do in HK. One of very few double decker tramways still in existence it is well worth the HK$2.50 fare to ride on teh upper deck of one of the trams. A great way to travel on a piece of history and see the sights of Central, Wanchai and Causeway bay
Ding Ding Trams. It was so nice travelling on the trainits super cheap and very friendlyI have to take a ride on the Trams everytime we go to HK

A ride back in time. If you have the time, the slow ride from Sheung Wan to Causeway Bay or North Point is a fascinating way to get an overview of the central part of Hong Kong. There can't be many rides that cost as little as this (currently $2:30).
Old world feel !!. leisurely way to traverse HK island, immaculately maintained, very affordable, takes you back to another era, very old-world feel. Lovely experiencce.

A Part of Hong Kong. I boarded the tram at Central and travelled through the busy streets of Wan Chai and finally alighted at Times Square Hong Kong (Happy Valley). The few stops has given me an insight on the lifestyle of Hong Kong residents, from the back alley markets to mega shopping malls with expensive brands. An experience not to be missed.

Cheap Economical Mode Of Transport. One of the best thing on Hong Kong Island. Tram fee is so affordable hence it is a popular mode of transport with locals. The tram is a great way to take in the sights and sounds of Hong Kong Island at a slow leisurely pace. You can choose to hop on and off, or simply sit on the top deck for the whole journey.

A look back in time. What other way is there to travel between Central and Causeway Bay on to Kennedy if you are not in a rush. It is pure enjoyment to see the locals using this mode of transport alongside the tourist for such a low price. Sit on the top deck if you can so that you take in all the sights you pass. A must on your visit to Hong Kong.

Good experience on the trams. Liked the pace of the tram cars. Crowded as it was popular among the locals due to its price. You enter the tram from the back and move all the way to the front. Don't forget to touch the reader or you'll hear the driver shouting at you. Saw that when a customer exited, touched the reader but the driver didn't see.
HK trams. A fun and economical way to see streetlife in some of the busier parts of HK. SIt on the top, at the front if possible, and keep your camera ready!

Love the trams. This was a real treat for the nerd. The trams are old and small and great fun to ride in. A real blast from the past. A night ride in off peak hours in the best (and choose a cooler day if you can as they are not AC'd). Of course, you can just use them as a transport service too!!

It's Fun if you're not in a rush. Don't take it during the rush hours, you will be ok. Cheap and provide great sightseeing. But after taking for countless time, it became very annoying due to their speed. Again, wanna go faster, take the subway or cab.

Great trip up to see the dizzy height of HK. Well worth the trip up and down. But the waiting time for the tram ride up the hill can be a long wait some times and days. But worth the trip in the end. Good views.

A must. You can not leave Hong Kong without using the Tramways.
No airco, steeming hot and full of people but an unforgettable view of downtown Hong Kong in the Causeway Bay, Chai Mai and Central area. You can pay the Tramway when leaving it with the Octopus card. This avoids the need for the exact amount of small change

Sit up on the 2nd deck and enjoy the ride. Whenever in Hong Kong I like to take an hour, grab a tram on the island, and enjoy seeing the city in a unique, up close way. I always try to get a front seat so I can enjoy the view, enjoy the other colorful trams passing by, and see Hong Kong a way that most likely could not be duplicated any other way

Limited range compared to MTR, but worth a trip.. You can get a four day unlimited pass if you are looking to travel among the limited route of the Main Island. Stops are frequent and there are some good temples to visit along the path if you are visiting. Great for short trips too!!

Free ride!. I tried out the Tram once for a short stretch, little knowing that there would be a free ride offered on the 29th May. Very sparsely populated unlike the MTR, the tram trundled through the streets with a loud noise. The Hong Kong bus drivers, who seem to have been race car drivers in their previous assignment, seem far too fast for the speed at which the tram moves. The best mode of transport if you want to watch the world move by at a slow pace, down the slope or vice versa

The joys of times past. Great way to get around the island. Although it is available in only one part of the city, it is still a great way to navigate that area. The frequency is great too and it maps a couple of attractions on the way, so you can easily squeeze it in your itinerary. Boasts a certain old school charm.

The quintessence of a bygone era....and fun!. Besides the Star Ferry, Hong Kong Island trams would have to be the cheapest, most pleasant and unique way to see the island. We were staying in Sheung Wan and as the tram ran past our hotel it seemed only natural to utilise them.They are not air-conditioned but have open windows, upper and lower decks, can be crowded and also time consuming. However, where the MRT has speed and distance, the trams with their distinctive bell, electric power and narrow body is the quintessence of a bygone era.The cost is a princely $2.30 HKD per trip no matter how far you travel without getting off. We went from Sheung Wan to Cityplaza Shopping Mall (nr Quarry Bay) and got off at the depot stop on King’s Road outside Tai Koo MTR Station. It took just under an hour (depending on traffic) and all for just the one price. Get on at the back sit or stand at the bottom or head upstairs (this is where the best views are). Pay when getting off downstairs near the driver (back doors will be shut). Have exact change or as we did, use a loaded Octopus card and place over the pad.Not the quickest or most comfortable way to commute but it was definitely the most enjoyable thing we have done in Hong Kong over several trips.They run so frequently that you never have to wait too long for one to come along. Some trams have been refurbished with newer seats but on the whole they are plastic and not sized for taller people – all part of the fun though!We loved it!Enjoy your experience!

First time in a very very long time. I hadn't used this form of transport in a very long time, and it was a joy to use it again.When everything is a rush in Hong Kong, it's good to see "slow" and steady things like the tram still kicking along. Enjoy the ride at the top level, for a cheap scenic tour of HK Island, as everyone goes on about their daily business.The only "modern" thing on these trams are the advertising billboard, and the use of the Octopus card - otherwise everything is still rattling along all OK.
Very cheap. Good view of city, cool sitting upstairs with light breeze, better than air com. So cheap and easy to use.

Taste of the Old Times. Taking the tram in HK is like stopping to smell the roses for HK standards. It's the slowest way to travel in HK, walking the normal HK walking speed might even be faster, haha! But it's a great experience, so don't miss this when you visit HK. Amidst the busy and almost always hurried lifestyle going on around you, you get the chance to observe the culture around you and also enjoy the sights in a relaxing way while you go around the city. The trams are one of the ways HK maintains its character.

Quirky Travel Option. The trams can actually be slower than walking but it is a great way to see what is going on in the teeming streets. They are also really cheap at 2.3HK dollars per trip however long. Give them a try!!

Nice experience. Going up the hills to experience another view of Hong Kong at the perks. Please don't go during weekend as the queue is an hour. Can take bus 15C from the MTR of Kam Zhong if you don't feel like walking for 15 minutes.
Great fun!. Just hop on the cable car, take a ride through Hong Kong Island and enjoy the bustling life that you are passing. Great fun for virtually no money. A must see!

Excellent. If you are not in a hurry, this tram is superb! You could see almost everything in Hong Kong tru the tram. You will definitely enjoyed it. Just dont mind the hard wooden bench, for it is natural. Haha

Discovery channel. In my humble opinion the Hong Kong trams are the best way to discover the city. It's not time efficient (kind of slow moving) but they are a very effective way to see multiple sides of HK. As a bonus, your companion will be happy that you cannot do anything but relax and enjoy what surrounds you for a change. For HKD2.30 you can take a quick overview of the different districts along the north side of HK Island. In particular the Kennedy Town (West) to North Point, Causeway Bay or Happy Valley (East) stretch. Score a sit on the upper deck, specially at the front if you can, and get ready to enjoy the trip.
Cheap and convenient. Easy to hop on and off (at about AU$0.35 per ride). Take a walk around Causeway bay shops, there is a huge range of products and prices.

Old can be better. A convenient way to get around, if you are near the stops.Trams are old, used mainly be senior citizens as a cheaper means of transport. Can be given some attention by authorities to make this more tourist friendly. Should be more like the trams in Melbourne.
Interesting but very crowded. nice way to slowly travel from central to causeway bay, but it is very crowded these days. So it has to be done at the right time.
Ding Ding!. They do look like super fun but the seats are hard and the routes are difficult to understand, Thankfully it's cheap and you can use your octopus card.

Cheap and romantic. This is a great way to see Hong Kong island. Note that it doesn't run to southern HK island nor Kowloon and new territories. Cheapest way to see Hong Kong at your own pace. It is incredibly romantic to sit upstairs on a train at night.

Great n easy way to see the whole side of Hk island. Take a ride from start to finish for only 2.3hkd which travels from one end of Hk island to other . Throughout the ride , u will pass through many areas from homes of locals , shopping district to 'so called Hk CBD . Although the whole ride may take over an hour you may hop on and off , having to pay again when u hop on again . But it cost barely anything compared to those hop on n off tourist buses
Exciting. It was exciting. But it has a long queque. Maybe you should go there if its not foggy in order to view well HK.

Ding Ding Tram. When visit to Hong Kong. We must try to take Ding Ding Tram to get the experience which only available in Hong Kong Island side. Eventhought its slow but you'll be see around and enjoyed its.

A must-do activity in Hong Kong. If you go to HK to travel, there are 3 things that you need to do:1) Take a tram at night, sit on the upper deck and enjoy the night scenes in HK (try to avoid the rush hours or else you will be sorry).2) Take the star ferry at night3) Take a Hong Kong old ship tour (Chinese Junk)These were part of HK's history, skipping them is kinda like going to Egypt without riding the camels.

great way to travel. As a Senior citizen I get special rates on the trams although it is a cheap way to travel.Go upstairs for the best views. Go from one end of the line to another the same price anywhere, but you get a feel of the different areas. Sometimes a bit crowded but worth it
Great ride. It is awesome sitting on the top deck, great view. Cheap way to travel along the top of HK island. However, give it a miss around 6pm, tricky to get off when very crowded.

easy transits. You can go anywhere for cheap price. I would recommend you to use tramways over subways. it kinda of small but can brings you to a place where you want to go while viewing the Hong Kong Town

Take the Ding Ding for a journey back in time. I used the tram several times during my stay in HK, travelling to and from my hotel in Wan Chai to Central. Entrance is at the rear through a tight turnstile and exit at the front. The trams were frequently crowded which I found meant it was best to gradually work towards the front to pay by Octopus Card or exact cash fare when leaving. I did not travel upstairs where I understand it is also permitted to stand, only because if I found the tram was at my stop or nearby a swift exit would have been required.It was all good fun, if you are in a hurry, use the MTR otherwise the tram is cheap, slow and not particularly comfortable. I never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for a tram and I had the assurance of knowing that if I got on one travelling in my direction I would be fine provided I kept an eye out of the window for my stop. The system is profitable for HK and a refurbishment programme is under way. Although some increased competition will come about from MTR in the next couple of years, this is an iconic form of transport without them it would be like San Francisco without the cable cars.

Feels like time travel in the old times!. What a way to tour the cities in cool breeze while you listen to the tracks riding on the rails on the Hong Kong Island side. It's quite a leisurely experience with the slower pace tram. This is especially true during earlier afternoon when locals are not taking them to and from work. You get to explore through different districts and get off when you see something interesting.The trams portray the old times and bring you into a time travel feel.
Cheap & conveniece. We took this tramways from causway bay all the way to Happy Valley.It's cheap and nice sight seeing. love the entrance and exit out only to pay the fare.

A cheap, great way to see Hong Kong Island. The trams run East-West along the busy northern side of Hong Kong Island. They're relatively thin and look like they'll topple over at any moment, but are quite safe. They're cheap to ride (HK$2.30) and have great views from the upper deck. If you're travelling between Central and Causeway Bay, definitely take the tram at least once. During peak hour, however, the subway would be faster.
Road around the city with tram. with a very cheap price, you can road around the city using this slowly tram. Take a picture of many good place. stop at good tourist spot, and many more

Take the Ding Ding for a fun ride through Hong Kong. I used the tram several times during my stay in HK, travelling to and from my hotel in Wan Chai to Central. Entrance is at the rear through a tight turnstile and exit at the front. The trams were frequently crowded which I found meant it was best to gradually work towards the front to pay by Octopus Card or exact cash fare when leaving. I did not travel upstairs where I understand it is also permitted to stand, only because if I found the tram was at my stop or nearby a swift exit would have been required.It was all good fun, if you are in a hurry, use the MTR otherwise the tram is cheap, slow and not particularly comfortable. I never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for a tram and I had the assurance of knowing that if I got on one travelling in my direction I would be fine provided I kept an eye out of the window for my stop. The system is profitable for HK and a refurbishment programme is under way. Although some increased competition will come about from MTR in the next couple of years, this is an iconic form of transport without them it would be like San Francisco without the cable cars.

Is this for real?. Antiquated tram system that wobbled and bobbled through the traffic- sort of Harry Potteresque. If you are staying in Soho this tram system delivers you to wherever you want to go on Hong Kong Island

Better than any tourbus. Going by Hong Kong Tramways is a must. Sitting on the upper floor you can see the busy area of Hong Kong. You have to pay for the ride, when you leave the tramway. You should have the exact amount, cause there is no change possible. Best route is from Sheung Wan (Western Market) to Shau Kei Wan.

great ride even when raining. For less than $2 you can take a tram ride across Hong Kong Island. It's a nice way to take a break and see life in Hong Kong. When you get bored just jump off and go to the closest MTR to get you back.I took the tram when it was raining and at times it felt like I was in the middle of the movie Blade Runner
best way to get around. The public transportation is awesome. It also is great to get be able to get out of the hot humid weather that we experienced while we were there.

Fun to experience. Great way to travel along Hong Kong island and see the man buildings. Need to have the right change or an Octopus card. Lots of trams so no real wait. Very narrow steps up to the top and walk way so keep bags to a minimum!
Elegant and frail. These grasshoppers will move you around accros the city - a bit slowly but with style. Going to the top deck gives you better view as you go allong.
Traveling in historical double-decker trams.. It is "just Hong Kong" to travel on the tramways. Do not miss them. Very enjoyable and very practical.

colourful. delightful, slow and colourful. also the cheapest transport in hong kong wherever it runs.the trams from happy valley to central, we took almost daily and quite liked them. sit at the top floor.
Cheap Transport. It's a cheap, but slow way to commute in HK Island. You can treat this as a cheap way to tour along the city center.

Fun for sightseeing. We rode the tram all the way from near Sheung Wan to Causeway Bay and it was a splendid way to see some of the city. Don't get a tram if you want to get anywhere in a hurry, at several points in the journey it would have been a lot quicker to walk but it does mean that you have plenty of time to take in the sights. Thoroughly recommended.

Nice way to see the city. Hi, I did the tram ride last week when i was in HK. Though it is very slow, it was good just to sit around and not have a specific point to get down in mind and so cheap, only HKD2.30 per person. I went from Central to Wanchai and back. Good trip and took some good photos too of the vibrant city. Worth doing!

Historic and unique experience. Take an hour and ride the tram along the main corridor in Hong Kong for about $1. You will see the high rises from residential to business and financial districts. The trams are very colorful compared to the dull green of years past. Enjoy the ride.

slow but sure. an economical way to move around HK island. It may be slow but it gets you to your destination just as well as the MTR minus the long walk from street level to trains. Also, the tram ride gives you a glimpse of HK life.
Unique way to travel. Unique to Hong Kong, these rather quaint and narrow double decker trolley buses are fun and useful. Can be crowded at times, but always worth a go.

stepping back in time. If you go to HK you must travel with the tram. It is an interesting experience. This trams are really old two deckers and they are going around these skyscrapers. They look so much contrastring with their surroundings its like you step in and out of a time machine.

Brilliant experience. Had a great morning going on the tram and the a lovely meal at the top a great place to visit for an afternoon or morning. Fantastic views when your up there breath taking a must on your places to visit.

Because even the place is too far,when you ride in a tram you can still relaxed.. I love the looks of the tram,the way it's been built. but the one I don't like about are the people pushing us and really the smell of the people around us.

A good and inexpensive way to travel. If your on the Hong Kong island a good and cost effective way to travel is by tram. This is a historical tram from the English colonial days. A good and inexpensive way to travel

A legacy of the colonial days. One of the best things about Hong Kong is that the city preserves its rich colonial heritage in the midst of all the modernity and development. The tramways still operate and serves both residents and tourists alike and is very very cheap and adventurous way to explore Hong Kong. Suggest to take the tram from Central towards Happy Valley and back to Central - within 1 hour, one can have a good glimpse of Hong Kong!
very affordable but slow. Tram is the cheapest way to travel in Hongkong. You can enjoy the slow pace of the tram and enjoy the sites or places that you pass by. Very convenient.

great way to check out the city life. its funny how the oldest and the most classic transportation still running on one of the busiest city in the world, it gives you time to relax and check out the city

Ting Ting Cher. Is very special transport which got lots of argument to keep so call "Ting Ting Cher" until now. you will be surprise with the price to ride with this transport, which is only HKD 2.30, Is really enjoyable... cool man... I ride this after went to mid hill central escalator and have some very nice dinner in food stall so call "Tai Pai Tong". Must try it... The service of this iconic transport will be cease once the new HK MTR which cover those area been completely build.
A lovel way to travel!. I loved this old fashioned way of transport - it's cheap and colourful, wonderful sights to see as you trundle along, the "local"ness of your fellow travellers, the cost!

Good, and cheap. Very efficient train service, and you can go for days on a $20 ticket. Well marked and easy to navigate if you've ever been on a subway anywhere. Stations are sometimes hard to find from street level.
Slow but effecient. A visit to Hong Kong wouldn't be complete without at least one ride on a tram. Even if it's not going your way. BTW,the upper deck is more fun.

Double Deck Trams, Double Fun. Going around Central involves a lot of one-way roads, narrow roads and quite some traffic jam on rush hours. The trams are unique and double-decked, eco-friendly and super cheap if you want to explore the area. Note though that this would be better to take if you are not in a rush so you could really take time to see and tour Central.
very slow. as a visitor you must travel on the tram but as for getting anywhere soon forget it. very slow. but great way to see HKG. MTR AND BUS QUICKER
Take it easy. For a mere HKD 2.50 you can take a slow tram ride through HK. enjoy the sights of a bustling city at a leisurely pace.

A wonderful experience. Travel on the trams, is cheap and VERY convenient. Not to mention, being able to get some great pics from the upper level of the trams. The trams have a charm of their own, and enhances the experience of visiting Hong Kong. In particular Hong Kong Island.

The Only Double Deck Trams in the World!. These trams are both unique and a fun way to see Central and Wanchai in Hong Kong. The cost is also rediculously cheap, but does require exact change. Get an Octopus card at the airport or any number of stores throughout Hong Kong. They can be used for all public transit to avoid always having to have the exact change, avoid lining up to buy tickets for the metro and make routine purchases at many stores throughout Hong Kong. One note on the tram is that it is not air conditioned so you may want to avoid them on the very hot days. The Tram is a fun way to see Central and you can take it all the way to Happy Valley Racetrack and back or get off for a tour and take the metro or a bus back to Central. Well worth it to say you went on the only double decker tram in the world.
Great fun. A fun and cheap way to get around. Just board any tram at the rear, go as far as you would like, and pay by octopus card on your way out (at the front).

This one way to go around the city. Its a cheaper way to travel around the city and while enjoying the scenary and beauty of the places;) and fun to view every building and structure of hongkong since there are no houses u can see its an apartment type ;) unique

A different experience!. If you have the time the tram is a good way to travel. Stopping at the Traders Hotel, we used it often. It is slow but cheap but you see lots more than by any other method. I am not sure whether they are upgrading the trams but there seemed to be fewer about than previously but some had more modern interiors.
Not too sure. I believe this is a must for tourists, however I would not say this was one of my most exciting experiences....

What a gem in old Hong Kong. This was really a treat and well worth the experience. The old trams run efficiently and work well. Crammed in peak times but so worth the experience.A Must in Hong Kong and the only this that is really cheap

Good for short distance. I take tram for short distance, for more than 3 MTR stations, I prefer to take MTR. Of course it's cheaper comparing to MTR. Tram costs HK$ 2.30 while MTR costs HK$ 4.9 (i.e. from Central to Causeway Bay). As the tram moves slow, it's good to check where we should stop, we can sit at the top to get better view.I like passing Wan Chai street market, choose the seat facing the street market and take nice pics from the tram.

Watch out if you are tall. The double decker trams in Hong Kong are a sight to see, and also quite cheap to use, however they are built for the locals so if you are tall like me make sure you squat. Also they can become very crowded.
Great fun and cheap as chips. Best tip is to buy an Oyster card as you need to have the correct change. 2 HKD each and really good fun, give it a try

Great.. Our visit was nice but spoiled a little by the mist - it was such a misty day we could hardly see anything when the tram reached the top of the hill! But good views all the same. Fun for a little ride, 10 mins and worth trying.
Just what we needed to get from Traders HK. We were staying in Traders and the tram stopped nearby, enabling us to get into the centre. It was a great experience not to be missed.

A Love Affair. I seldom take a tram since our city got rid of ours many years ago.
Being on one gives me a great feeling of going back in timt

A must do for any HK Tourist. A ride on the ding ding is an absolute must do when you're in Hong Kong. It's cheap ($2.3 per adult), convenient, and if you grab a seat upstairs it's a great way to watch this busy place while traveling through it at a slow pace.It is a working mode of transport and as such can get very busy, so best avoid rush hour.
Value for money. if you want to see how the locals travel, take a tram for the cost of only HKD2.30! what can be more value for money than this?

Interesting if you are not in a hurry. Ride the tram up and down Hong Kong island to get a taste of how life used to be before the MTR and the traffic. Cheap fares and an excellent way to take in the views if you are not in a hurry. Peak hours can be claustrophobic, so be warned.

Economical and Unique. Nothing captures the essence of Hong Kong's character like Hong Kong Tramways. With a super low tariff (flat rate) it feels like travelling for free. And it's only in Hong Kong that you can buzz past jam packed streets in Central in a sleek little "ding ding" (as trams are affectionately called by locals). I've been travelling by trams for over three years now and am as much a fan as I first was.

Good cheap transport, an expeirence. Great way to get around, you do need to know where you are going as this is not geared tor tourists so there is no pre warning of the next stop. The price is very cheap.

A taste of history. Yet another great mode of transport in HK for a value of HK$2-ish. Head to the top floor, sit in the front and enjoy the views pass you by. Not the fastest way to get around, but suits when you can't get a taxi or after the races in Happy Valley.A HK classic.

Get a ride.. This is a nice a pleasant way to travel along Hong Kong and see hoe is it, Enjoy the views as if you were travelling in a two storeis bus but cheap and fast and comfortably. Do not worry about the wether just take it as you please you can use your octopus card that I recommend to travel in Hong Kong for it is very convinient.
Easy to use. Trams in HK are cheap and easy to get around in. But can get crowded on peak hours and Sundays. Fares usually around HKd 2.20 and you can use Octopus card or coins.
Great value. HK$2.30 for a trip as long as you like, great way to see the streets of HK and cheap enough to jump off and on when you see something of interest.
Cheap fun way to travel around the Island. This is a great way to travel along the Island and get a great view of the surrounding area. Cheap at only 4.50 hk $.

So cheap and good fun for visitors. Local people still use ding-ding to go to work but also is nice for visitors can have enjoyment to go slow along the street. Can see many buildings, shopping and can get off when you like. Its fun activity and not expensive. I suggest you try when you come to Hong Kong.

Cheap and cheerful. This is simply the cheapest way to experience Hong Kong island. At $2.3 HK it is a cheap sightseeing tour. Yesterday I took my parents on the tram and on the rickshaw bus and they both agreed they enjoyed and saw more from the tram. It is slow but you get the opportunity to experience HK life rather than a tour. As they are cheap they are also crowded. Do it and enjoy a swaying slice of history.
Awesome scenery. It is a very crowded attraction but it is all worth it. To make your waiting shorter take the bus tour of the city and you have the priority check in that goes with it.

Worth using. Plenty of trams, but in the middle of the city only one rail.Quite cheap, with average sitting and narrow space to move (a necessity in this city). Take care with the stairs to/from upper deck.

Pram tram rocks. These trams are just great for getting about as a tourist, much easier than buses. The new trams even tell you where you are - what a gimic.Best buy the travel card, though as makes an already cheap ride even cheaper.I would return to Hong Kong just to ride the trams again.
Only go if weather is clear. Have been up this three times. Once the weather was crystal clear and the views were fantastic. However, trip is not worth it in poor weather.
Please note -only on Hong Kong Island.. Used by locals and tourists alike, they are a quaint way to travel. Limited routes, but fun nevertheless

Great if you are not in a rush to go anywhere.. The Hong Kong commuters who actually use the trams to get around must really love the hordes of tourists who are only there to experience a swaying, clanking slice of Hong Kong history. It is only beaten by Star ferry as the best value tourist attraction in Hong Kong and is definitely worth jumping on for a couple of stops.
HK trams. very good way to see HK Island by the cheapest mode. They are pretty fast also, covers almost entire city.
Fun and fantastic.. Travel was so easy. The tram system is fun and fantastic. Virtually travel anywhere any time.A bit crowded at times but then AGAIN THERE ARE A LOT OF PEOPLE TO MOVE AROUND.

Too small tram, Not comfy. -Too small tram, unlimit passengers.
-Classic transport
-Uncomfy on tram
-Stations signage is so small and hardly to find (for me)

Can be crowded but great to take a trip. Very crowded morning evening and lunchtimes we found. But great to take a trip and enjoy the experience. Have you octopus card ready and swipe as you get off. Incredibly good value but then so is the MRT and even the taxi fares are reasonable.

fun and authentic. Take nay of the trams in Hong Kong, the experience to travel on public transport and get the inner city vibe is remarkable. fare is so cheap I think just 2.30 HKD. And try to see upstairs so you can get better views
Best way to travel!. We loved it as a family and always found lots of helpful people to direct us. Plus it is very cheap!

little bit slower line than expected. the service is very cheap and very easy if you do not have to use them for a long run. but for short cut it is very useful. it is a little bit slower than expected since sometimes you get stuck also in line with three or four tram in front of you and you have to wait.

Cheapest tourist attraction in HK and worth every penny!. This is such a cheap mode of transport (approx 20p) which can be very busy but really captures the hustle and bustle of the city (along with all the sights and smells). Take the tram at night to see all the buildings illuminated and sit at the front upstairs!

Cheap and good experience. HK tram is fast and efficient, no matter of how far you travel it only cost you HKD 2.30 which is very cheap. It's very crowded during peak hours, but the tram is very frequent.

paying practically nothing to sight seeing the most bustling city. the cheapest way to get around the city, it runs between the west to the east side of the HK island, passing through many residential blocks, the financial center and some of the most well known shopping districts. If you are in a hurry wanting to get some places fast, don't think this HK$2.30 (US 0.30 cent less) fare ride will take you there on time, most locals who use this transportation know that and don't mind about the snail speed. It is like the cable car in San Fransico, Califirnia. As much as how efficient the MTR (mass transit railway) or buses system run, when I go to Causeway Bay or North Point, I take the ding ding tram and I love to get onto the 2nd level where I can enjoy the bustling city passing beneath me and the air is "fresher" (okay, put the air pollution index aside). You can close the window if you do get cold or when it rains, each huge window has a single handle bar and just pull upward. By the way, they just come out with one new model, a very sleek looking ding ding with auto swing door entrance instead of the old turnstile metal bars, they also put out the digital display sign so that you know where you are at, see photos. The only minor complaint is the seat can be hard, but I am sure they choose durability over comfort. If you have time and want to slowly absorb the local scenery, this is the way to go, nothing beat the price!
Great find!!. We bought an octopus card and used the tram to go all over the place it is a great way to see the sites and very affordable.

Tram has to be taken at least once while in HKG. If you find the Tram lines to be longer than you care to wait, take the local bus to the peak.The Hong Kong buses are clean and fun to ride. The general public is very nice to visitors from all countries.
A must experience when in Hong Kong!. Great way to get around the city and catch all the sites, people watching. Go upstairs on the tram for fantastic views of the vibrant citylife.

good way to see Hong Kong at a leisury space. Very cheap and comfortable way to see Hong Kong at a slow space. The ding ding trams run from east to west , there is also a line to Happy Valley . You can see the changing aspect of the neighborhoods, from up scaled Central and Casaway bay to the more working class areas of Hk
Fun way to get around!. Get an Octopus Card when you arrive and all travel on public transportation is easy. The trams are unique double deckers that you learn quickly how to navigate.
Worth a ride. For $2 HK you can't g wrong. We rode as far as North Point and got off to look round the food market there. The tram was very crowded as it was Sunday. Ma be quieter on other days..
Ride the length of HK Island. Start from wherever you are get a tram and go to North Point or Western - see plenty of local HK areas - then ride back again. I always recommend it to my
great little experience. they look so retro that every time they pass you, you just want to hop on for a little trip and it is so worth it although not a major attraction it is quiet the experience
Cool Ride. If you have the time, ride one of the trams for the fun of it. During Sundays and rush hour, it can get crowded, but hop on and enjoy the ride
Not for an average westerner. The trams are great to watch. I wouldn't recommend an average size westerner to ride them too much though. also watch your head if you are close to 6" tall.

Ding Ding. The best way to travel if you have alot of time in hand.Very Very cheap, The trams get from one side of Hong Kong island to another. It offer a glimpse into the past. Payment is convenient the trams accept your Octopus card.

Rush, rush Hong Kong style. Trams are very efficient especially in the crowded Central districts. Cheap and convinient.
I have been using them since i was a kid, visiting HK for holidays. Still the same, very nostalgic.
Always fun. One of the small pleasures of being in Hong Kong is taking the tramways. Good views (go to the top), and the Central takes you through the downtown....nice birds-eye view.

Great way to get a view of the city from the ground. The trams were great - but beware, you have to have the correct change (which is about 2.30), which you pay on exit, no matter how far you travel. We got on the trams before dusk and travelled to the terminal, stayed on and travelled back. On the return trip it had got darker and therefore enjoyed the lights of Hong Kong - excellent value

Good experience. This is a good experience for anyone wanting a ride on the old fashioned trams. Although can get crowded but somehow the crowd is civil and moves along. Would help if there were indications of which stops were coming up, since this is a tourist attraction. Kids enjoyed the ride from Central to Causeway Bay.
Qwerty way to ride the city. They're great. Not quite as archaic as SF'scable cars but still a wonderful reminder of former time stil in action.Please keep them HK they're wonderful!

A must-do when you are in Hong Kong. I love HK's old trams. First rode it during my first trip to Hong Kong 22 years ago and I remember it as a most exhilarating experience. It is a great way to see Hong Kong as it slowly moves through the busy streets of Hong Kong. Have been to Hong Kong 4 times in the past 22 years and every time I sat foot in this Pearl of the Orient, I always made sure I took a few rides in this quaint vehicle. During my last visit to Hong Kong last year, I stayed in the western part of Hong Kong. To get to the MTR station, I can choose to take a bus or the tram, but 9/10 times, I will take the tram even though it was a bit slower. I do recommend it for visitors to Hong Kong as a must-do activity.
Hong Kong Slow Tour. Riding the tram is always a relaxing time unless you are waiting for it during rush hours... best to go during brunch hours or before lunch!

Authentic Feel. The trams are a fun an cheap way to get from one side of Hong Kong island to another. Although some in the fleet are quite modern, you can still find trams that have a feeling from a few decades ago; which, offer a glimpse into the past with the pace of life back then. Payment is convenient as well as the trams accept your Octopus card and charge only a small levy.Just some pointers of advice: During noon, be prepared for a slow tram ride as there are a lot of people on the streets and traffic. If you want to get from A to B fast, don't consider a tram, but rather the MTR. These trams are more just for a slow and easy pace in a city that is usually a hive of activity.

cheap transport. Hong Kong tramways is a great form of public transport to travel around on HK island.It is cheap and you just get on and when you see something you like get off and check it out. Ther are stops every 500 metres or so.
Trams. Very convenient and plentiful enough. Cheap too! I got an Octopus card with stored value and this added to the convenience.

Rattle and Roll. There is something special about a tram ride on Hong Kong Island. It is important to know how to get onto the tram and find the stops but it is a great way to see the busy life passing by...just be ready to jump off when you reach your stop. Use your octopus card for this interesting rattle and roll ...

Fun and authentic. A fun and authentic and very cheap way to travel around HK! However, if you are tall (i.e. more than 6 foot) it isn't a great place to travel - my partner had to stoop over a lot. The trams get very crowded so be aware of when you need to get off as you can easily get stuck on the tram and miss your spot.

Fast around the island. Lovely that hk can include both new and old school transport so easily together. The tram is super value (20$) and gets you through the busy central streets probably faster than a cab would. Don't take if you have lot of luggage. Otherwise do it.

HK Trams. Best way to get around on the Island - $2.30 a trip, no matter how far you go. Not a lot of seating, but it ads to the adventure. A lot of visitors seem hesitant to board the tram - try it, it's fun.
